subject: euchre_test01 explanation
content: To help debug your euchre program (specifically euchre_test01), we have provided an explanation for  each players decision making in each hand.. . Helpful Tips:. 1. If your player is playing or leading the wrong card, take a look at the play_card function, specifically how you compare cards and consider trump.. 2. If your player has the wrong cards in their hand, take a look at the shuffle function in pack.. 3. If your player is calling up trump when it they aren't suppose to (or vice versa), take a look at the card classification functions in Card.cpp (is_trump, is_face_or_ace, is_right_bower, is_left_bower).. 4. Make sure you ALWAYS account for the left bower. It is considered a trump suit not it's original suit. Ex: if hearts was trump, the J of Diamonds is considered a heart not a diamond.. . You can find the explanation in the publicEECS280 drive or by clicking this link.

subject: P3 FAQ
content: P3 Overview. Slides. Recording. . Euchre Rules. Q: I’ve never played Euchre before, how do I learn the rules of the game?. . A1: Spec: EECS 280 Euchre Rules. . A2: Slides: Welcome to Euchre Afternoon. . A3: YouTube: How to Play EECS 280 Euchre with Simple Players. . Q: How come the left bower was played when the led suit is trump? Why didn’t the left bower follow suit?. . The left bower is always considered the trump suit! Let’s say trump is hearts. That means the left bower is the jack of diamonds. If the led suit is diamonds, playing the jack of diamonds DOES NOT follow suit because the left bower is considered the trump suit (aka hearts). If the led suit is hearts, playing the jack of diamonds DOES follow suit because the left bower is considered the trump suit (aka hearts).. Card.cpp. Pack.cpp. Q: Why won’t pack.in open in pack public tests when running on Xcode?. . Click on the name of your scheme in the toolbar at the top left, Edit Scheme > Options > Enable “Custom Working Directory” and press the little folder icon. Pick the folder that contains your code along with pack.in. This will ensure that the file is visible to your executable. This is usually not a problem, and we are investigating the issue.. Player.cpp. Q: Can I add helper functions while implementing the Player classes?. . You are allowed to use helper functions, but these helper functions should not change the interface of the class. So within your implementations of the class’s member functions, feel free to call helpers. But in your test files, you should not assume that these functions exist (because you should not alter the interface for the classes). This also applies in your euchre driver as well! e.g. If you add a helper function to the simple player class, you can use it within that class, but you can’t use it in the driver since it won’t be part of the Player interface!. . This is especially important because when we run your test cases against an intentionally buggy solution, that solution will not have your specially defined helper functions! So just use the interfaces of each class when you test them.. . Q: Do I need to worry about the human player doing (insert illegal move) during the game?. . No, in accordance with the spec you can assume that a human player will follow the rules of the game and will not attempt to cheat.. . Q: Why am I getting a compiler error for calling sort?. . Note that the sort function modifies the hand. You cannot modify member variables in a const function, so you’ll receive a compiler error you call sort in a const member function.. . You shouldn’t need to sort using card less. When you print the hand in order it should be sorted using the < operator. You could sort with card less when determining what action to take, but you should be able to find the min/max card in the hand without sorting. You could use a functor to sort using card less, but those are only covered later in the course. Generally: if you need to use sort, just the default one will be fine.. . Q: I keep getting an error: “error: creating array of ‘Player’, which is an abstract class type" or error: creating vector of ‘Player’, which is an abstract class type” or “Allocating an object of abstract class type Player” or “Allocating an object of abstract class to type Simple”…what does it mean?. . Player is an abstract class because it has at least one pure virtual function (see https://eecs280staff.github.io/notes/10_Polymorphism.html#abstract-classes-and-interfaces for a detailed description). You cannot create an object of an abstract class so you may not create a Player object. If you haven’t implemented all the player class functions in simple and human player, you also cannot create a simple or human player object because the simple and human classes inherit the pure virtual function.. . If you are getting the error on a line where you create a Simple or Human player, go back and ensure you coded each of the required functions. If you are getting the error on a line where you create a Player, think of another way to code the function. There are no instances where you should be creating a Player because none of it;s functions are implemented. Note: you are able to create a Player* that points to either a Simple or Human player. This is because you are not actually creating a Player object, you are actually creating a Simple or Human player object.. euchre.cpp. Q: Why am I passing euchre public test, but failing euchre public test with solution card, pack, and player?. . This means that when your euchre.cpp is run with the instructor solution implementations of card, pack, and player you produce incorrect output. This likely means that you’re making an incorrect assumption about what functionality should go in card/pack/player versus in the game of euchre. For example, make sure that you’re not printing output in player.cpp that should be printed in euchre.cpp..

subject: Learn to Play Euchre!
content: Hello everyone!. . Please get hyped for our world famous once-in-a-semester EECS 280 euchre social! This Saturday, February 4th, the EECS 280 staff will be hosting a student get-together where you and other students will have a chance to learn and play Euchre. Not only will you have a chance to enjoy a fun card game with other students, but this event is also very helpful for the logic behind coding project 3 - the Euchre project.. . From 12:00 - 12:15 pm EST in Mason Hall 1427, we will be giving a basic rundown of how to play Euchre before breaking off to play in smaller groups until 2pm. Cards will be provided, but do feel free to bring your own if you want.. . The link to the slides on how to play are located [here](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/129P1PUHSY4EA9N4Ag0CJlPc3tEowegAwLJ6E03vKhqw/edit?usp=sharing), but we will go over these again on Saturday. We look forward to seeing you!. . \-EECS 280 Staff

subject: Couple of Grading Questions
content: A couple of questions with grading: . . 1. Is it possible to see autograder private test error messages? I had a few errors with my pack reset function in p3 and am unsure what I did wrong. . . 2. I submitted a regrade request for the midterm and heard back from it around 7 pm today but had another question, is it possible to ask what I did wrong again? (I understand that regrade requests are closed) . . uniqname is haasf
i_answer: 1. We don't release information about private tests. As a matter of fact, I can't even see error messages of your private tests. If you'd like to discuss it, proffice hours would be a good place.. . 2. Unfortunately, we don't accept regrade requests after the deadline. A regrade request gives us a second chance to look at your answer more closely with a fresh mind, so it is unlikely that there is still a mistake. If you do believe there is still an error or would like to discuss with someone to understand your error better, you are more than welcome to attend staff office hours or proffice hours.

subject: Project 3 autograder
content: Hello,. . I submitted an admin request about this, but the final submission my partner and I made on the Autograder for Project 3 does not correctly reflect what we intended to submit. . . We were trying to save our submissions until we were sure that our own compilers were producing the correct results,. . We didn't realize that the Autograder would place a very long queue when we made our submissions attempts today, resulting in us rushing our submissions and the Autograder taking a very long time to process our submissions. So therefore, our last submission does not properly reflect what we intended to submit.. . So, we wanted to ask if it was possible that our submission that we made on March 10 at 7:27pm (53/69) or the submission made on February 23 (56/69) be graded instead? Whatever the higher score is, can we keep that one?. . Uniqnames: chenww, nwweaver. . Thank you very much.
i_answer: The score that will be used will be the highest overall score across all of your submissions (with both public and private tests).. . For future projects, definitely submit early and often, especially since you don't get any single day's submissions back if you don't use them. Use them or lose them.

subject: submission
content: Hello, . I had made a change to my project at the last second before submitting. It caused a compilation error, and I got a lower score than before. Would I be able to submit one more time as I still have one submission. If not could my previous submission be graded instead as it got a higher score than my last one.
i_answer: Your overall (public + private tests) best score is your final score for this project, not necessarily the score of the last submission.

subject: Can some one explain what this deep nesting error is telling me
content: Can some one explain what this deep nesting error is telling me:. . oclint -no-analytics -rule=DeepNestedBlock -rc=NESTED_BLOCK_DEPTH=4 -max-priority-1 0 -max-priority-2 0 -max-priority-3 0 Card.cpp Pack.cpp Player.cpp euchre.cpp -- -xc++ --std=c++11. . OCLint Report. . Summary: TotalFiles=4 FilesWithViolations=1 P1=0 P2=0 P3=2. . /home/autograder/working_dir/Player.cpp:104:39: deep nested block [size|P3] Block depth of 5 exceeds limit of 4. . /home/autograder/working_dir/Player.cpp:175:61: deep nested block [size|P3] Block depth of 5 exceeds limit of 4. . [OCLint (http://oclint.org) v0.13]
i_answer: You have two nested for-loops of depth 5, which exceeds the limit of 4.. Whenever you have a nested for/while/if, it adds one more depth. A depth 2 nested for-loop  could  look like this: . for (...) {.   for (...) {.     }. }. A depth 5 nested for-loop could look like this:. for (...) {.   for (...) {.     if (...) {.       while(...) {.         if (...) {.                   }.              }.          }.     }. }.

subject: Can some one explain what this deep nesting error is telling me
content: Can some one explain what this deep nesting error is telling me. . deepnesting.png
i_answer: Deep nesting means that you have too many nested cpp elements. This includes if/else, for, while, functions (anything that has the {}). Ways to limit your deep nesting is creating helper functions or re-evaluating your logic. Try to combine cases so you don't need as many nested {}.. . Example:. . if { if { while { for {} } } }

You could test if your AS works by deliberately writing a buggy program (uninitialized values for example) and run it with the AS flag on.. subject: String to suit assertion failed
content: When running euchre for the simple and human player, we're getting an assertion failure for string_to_suit which we're not sure why we're getting/ how to fix. We think that it might be because some function is reading in "pass" as a suit but we're not sure where its happening/ how to fix it
i_answer: I would use the debugger, find exactly at what line of code the values aren't what you'd expect them to be, and then dive into those functions and see why they aren't behaving. Something that might be useful is using conditional breakpoints. Feel free to google how to use them, but on VSCode, you right click a breakpoint, edit it, and it'll let you set conditions for the breakpoint such as "round == 1", which will only trigger when the round is 1. There's also hit count, which just triggers after the xth time the breakpoint is hit.. . If the problem is when you read in 'pass' as a suit, put a conditional breakpoint in string_to_suit for (suit == pass) or the likes :)

subject: Gabriel has one wrong card during Hand 2 of euchre_test01
content: When I run euchre_test01 on my program, every player except Gabriel are receiving the correct cards during Hand 2. Gabriel has one wrong card in his hand which is Queen of Hearts when it should be King of Diamonds. I realized after the cards are being shuffled, theses two cards should be in opposite spots in the deck however all the other cards are in the right spot. Are there any suggestions on how to fix this?Screen_Shot_2023-03-10_at_1.13.22_PM.png. Screen_Shot_2023-03-10_at_1.19.40_PM.png
i_answer: Yes. I would use the debugger, find exactly at what line of code the values aren't what you'd expect them to be, and then dive into those functions and see why they aren't behaving. Something that might be useful is using conditional breakpoints. Feel free to google how to use them, but on VSCode, you right click a breakpoint, edit it, and it'll let you set conditions for the breakpoint such as "round == 1", which will only trigger when the round is 1. There's also hit count, which just triggers after the xth time the breakpoint is hit.

subject: Memory leak in euchre.cpp on autograder, sanitizer doesn't tell me anything
content: Hi, on autograder my uniqname is zramzan, I've passed all the tests in the autograder but all the Euchre Public Tests have a memory leak. I have my sanitizer on my IDE (xcode) and it doesn't tell me anything's wrong. I'm also not sure how to interpret the information here to start debugging. Any help would be appreciated. Thank you.
i_answer: It's telling you that in line 281 of euchre.cpp, you call a function in Player.cpp, that, at line 275, will allocate memory that isn't being deleted. Just make sure you have a delete statement for every new statement and you should be a-okay

subject: EXC_BAD_ACCESS on index in a vector of players
content: For my deal function, I keep getting this error code that says exc_bad_access when trying to give a player a card. Google says its because i am accessing "bad" memory. What is bad memory and how do I fix it?
i_answer: It means you're either dereferencing a pointer whose object has been deleted, or you're accessing a vector at an index that doesn't exist. Likely the second one if I were to guess.

subject: Segmentation fault in test_pack_istream_ctor
content: I keep getting a segmentation fault for my pack constructor through istream. This is caught under UB checks and my entire program works fine. I've tried two different codes but can't seem to understand what's the issue. I'm attaching a picture of my code down below. I would really appreciate any help. Thank you.. . . .
i_answer: You segfault because you once use getline which reads the whole line, but then you also use another string stream to read in that line. You can combine the two, and I recommend using the operator >> as the header of a while loop, so. . . while(pack_input >> c) {. 	// add card to your deck. }

subject: Euchre UB Checks
content: Screenshot_2023-03-10_at_11.19.43_AM.png. I am getting flagged on an UB check for euchre and I'm not sure why. Could someone take a look at my code?. . Thanks!
i_answer: It looks like the error is saying "Error: attempt to subscript container with out-of-bounds index -1, but 10 container only holds 1 elements." It seems there might be somewhere you have an array or vector and you're trying to access the value at index -1. I would look for where you use those data structures and how the index you use when accessing their elements is updated, or if there's somewhere you default set that index to -1 planning to always change it.

subject: Long function error
content: The long function style check is failing in autograder and saying my Card_less has 41 non-commenting source statements but my function is only 23 lines.
i_answer: I believe the style check is checking statements, not lines. If a statement spans multiple lines it's counted once. From that I assume that if multiple statements are on the same line it will count them as multiple statements. If you see that's the case try fixing it and post a follow-up if it doesn't work or this answer doesn't apply.Docs for context: https://oclint-docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/rules/size.html

subject: Sort function not working in add_card

subject: Failing Euchre UB Check
content: When we run the euchre tests in our own terminal in VS Code, we get the correct output and none of the files differ. However, we are failing the UB checks in autograder and the expected output vs the student output differ. The student output is completely blank except for the last line, stating which team won - which returns the correct output.. . We are deleting all players and objects created using new, so we're not sure what to do. . . Would it be possible for an instructor to take a look at our code? .
i_answer: I would recommend looking into setting up [address sanitizer](https://eecs280staff.github.io/tutorials/setup_asan.html) or running your code on CAEN with valgrind to check for the memory leaks. subject: I am getting an error my teammate is not
content: I am getting this error which my teammate is not getting and we are both using VS code.. .
i_answer: You have to restructure your code to avoid the following problems:. 1. If the if clause isn't executed in line 286 in `euchre.cpp`, `next_suit` is uninitialized and would be returned by the function, which could cause undefined behaviors. My recommendations would be to make sure setting `next_suit` to something in all cases if you want to return.. 2. In line 106 of `euchre.cpp`, you are attempting to assign the member variable `trump` to itself, which doesn't make sense. Perhaps you want to assign it to some other values?

subject: Long function problem
content: . Can anyone help me with this? I've been struggling with the problem for a week. My teammate went to the office hour and was told that we have to shorten our main function. We did but it didn't work. Can anyone help us check what our problem is?. . xinyaxu
i_answer: The error is telling you that your main function is still too long - your main function is 43 non-commenting lines long, which exceeds the limit of 40. Note that because the style check is for non-commenting lines of source code, simply removing blank lines will not bring this number down. You must actually lessen the number of functional lines of code in the main function. My main suggestion for how to do this would be making additional helper functions within your game class to handle some functionality in your main function. Adding players and deleting players are two examples of parts that could be done in a helper function.

subject: Trying to debug shuffle
content: Hello,. . My partner and I are debugging shuffle. It works for euchre test 00, but we seem to be a card off in euchre test 01. This problem persists and worsens each hand. We wrote out how each card should move after each of the 7 shuffles in "shuffle", and want to confirm we are doing it correctly. Our problem for hand 0, which we use as a reference to check our work, is that Edsger is meant to receive a 9 of Hearts, but instead he receives a 10 of Diamonds. Pack.in has the 10 of diamonds at index 19 and our shuffle function should (as we understand it) move it to index 9, where Edsger is draws it from. The 9 of Hearts starts at index  6 and moves to index 20. However, Edsger is supposed to have it in his hand?  We are confused and are having a difficult time finding our bug. Attached is the diagram of how we think the indices are supposed to change after each shuffle (we went through 7). Any help would be greatly appreciated. . . Thank you! . . .
i_answer: Excellent debugging method! You are correct on everything but I think you might be forgetting a rule of euchre. In round 1, if the upcard suit is called trump then the dealer picks up the upcard and discards his lowest card. Edsger has the 9 of hearts in his hand because he is the dealer and hearts was called (which is the upcard). . . I bet other students have this question too. If you feel comfortable, please make this question public so other students can see it!

subject: Autograder long function and deep nesting error
content: Hi, I was wondering how I could go about fixing my deep nesting errors and the long function problems? I know where the problems are in euchre.cpp and player.cpp, but I was wondering if anyone could take a look at my code and provide some suggestions on how I can fix this, since I tried and was having trouble with it? Thanks
i_answer: Here are my go to strategies to have better style. . . 1. Try breaking your function up into sections. Can you create a (or a few) helper functions to call inside the function. This would make the function shorter because a bulk of the code will be taken out and it can also get rid of some deep nesting. Lets say if you had 4 nested and you put 2 in the helper function. This would mean we have a deep nesting of 2 and 2 which passes.. . 2. I also try to think about simplifying/combining if/else statements. Especially in this project we have a lot of "if this then do this" logic so simplifying can make your code shorter and potentially less nested. Make a list of all the possible outcomes and what would result in each outcome (find overlap in the cases!). . I bet other students have this question so if you feel comfortable please make this post public!

subject: Why is the autograder showing the lines for one submission but not the other?
autograder style errors arent popping up
i_answer: If all your code does not compile, the prerequesites are considered not met, thus the style checks won't run (which is the first part of screenshot). The second style check error does give you information on what is failing. It says you have duplicate code. Think about maybe creating a helper function or re-evaulating your logic to fix the duplication.. . . . For more information on style checks see https://eecs280staff.github.io/tutorials/setup_style.html.

subject: String to rank assertion issues
content: My partner and I are running into issues with autograder. We are passing all the public tests on our own devices but the autograder says we have an assertion failure with the string to rank function on line 40. We have checked everywhere we used anything relating to that function and see no issues. There are no instances where we read in improperly formatted cards nor do we index out of bounds with the pack constructor. Can someone check the autograder to see what the issue is?. . my unique name is lania
i_answer: You are initializing your pack incorrectly. It looks like you are assigning an ifstream object into a pack object rather than call thing pack constructor. Try calling the pack constructor instead by pack = Pack(packfilein). Also make sure you have throughly tested the pack ifstream constructor.

subject: euchre01 Edsgar Hand 0
content: I was wondering if Edsgar hand (in hand 0) post shuffling, pre trump making was supposed to have Ten of Diamonds? Because the way my code is working, Edsgar is not discarding the Nine of Hearts, since it has a smaller value than Ten of Diamonds. Otherwise, all of the cards in Hand 0 are dealt correctly, which is a bit confusing.. .
i_answer: When running `add_and_discard`, we assume that the upcard's suit is trump. So when adding Nine of Hearts to the hand and checking for the lowest card, we consider Hearts to be trump. So, Ten of Diamonds is less than Nine of Hearts.

subject: Spring 2019 Q1A
content: . . Why wouldn't i start at 0 in the for loop? If i starts at 1 doesn't it skip over the string "Lobster/0"?
i_answer: I think it's okay if the loop starts at 0. However, 0 is already "counted" in the first line (const char* = longest strings[0];), so starting at 0 would be redundant (if you use int i = 1, the very first iteration compares longest, strings[0], with strings[1]).

subject: Weird issue where terminal output is different from debugger output.
content: I have an issue for the euchre_test01 test. The output through the debugger is correct while the terminal output is incorrect. . . Terminal output: . . . Debugger output (I set a break point towards the end of my play function to see the output): . . It may seem like just a one point difference but there are many differences like when things like "march!" are printed out.. . Here are the arguments I pass into the terminal:. . . Here are the arguments  I pass into the debugger: . . . As you can see they are the same arguments. And I do make euchre.exe every time as well to make sure everything is up to date. I also tried running the code on my partner's laptop who uses vscode on mac. The output was the same output as the incorrect terminal output. I put the debugger output into diff checker and compared it with the correct output and there was no difference so I don't think it's an issue with the code. This is the only test in which the terminal behaves weirdly. All my other tests have the same outputs as the correct ones. I'm not really sure what to do because I'd usually just debug in a situation like this but I can't because the debugger output is not the same as the terminal output. I know we're in break but if anyone could help out that would be great. Thanks in advance.
i_answer: It is hard to determine exactly what is wrong with the information given. I would suggest going to OH for more debugging help. My bet, though, is that this discrepency is coming form undefined behavior. Make sure that you initialize all of your variables, especially if you want the ints to start at 0. When you don't initialize your variables like "int x;" the computer chooses whatever number it wants to be x. So when you run it on the visual debugger, it might choose 0 and when you run it through the terminal it might choose 1. Given that is is miscalculating march, I would suggest seeing if you initialize the variable you use to keep track of how many tricks a team has won.

subject: order_up_suit not modified
content: My outputs for euchre.exe are weird. I made a few out statements and recognized that there is an issue with the order_up_suit. I initialized order_up_suit as upcard.get_suit() and the output shows that it never changes. However, all my player_tests on make_trump have passed and in those tests order_up_suit is successfully modified. Has anyone faced a similar problem? How do I deal with this?
i_answer: When you order up trump in round 2, you have to be sure that you change the trump in euchre. You can do this by using the make_trump order_up_suit parameter. Notice how this parameter is passed by reference. That means a duplicate object is not created and the original object passed into the function is changed. You can use that parameter to make sure you change trump in euchre. If you have a member variable "trump", then passing that variable directly into the make trump function will ensure it is changed if the trump is made in round 2.

subject: Card values are equal
content: How do we deal with the fact that some cards are the same value (e.g. the Nine of Clubs and the Nine of Diamonds when the trump is hearts) and our code drops/leads/plays one card while the test we are given drops/plays/leads the other card? Does this not matter on the autograder or is there a way to fix this?
i_answer: They’re not treated as equal in the way they’ve set up the game. If you look in the specs when the rank is tied the suits break the tie.

subject: P3 & Midterm Overlap
content: Hello!. I'm unsure if this is the right place to bring this up, but I've discussed it with several other students, and it seems to be a common concern.. . First off, I wanted to just quickly appreciate all that the staff + IA team have been doing to keep us informed and supported during this time :). . With the original P3 time frame, we should've had a week and a half worth of time to focus solely on midterm prep. With the modified one, we still should've had a few day's worth of time.. . However, with autograder repairs now ongoing throughout Monday, my concern is that this may considerably cut into time that should've been used just for midterm prep.. . Even if a student's project is fully finished, and it's just a matter of them turning it in, actually turning it into autograder may end up revealing issues they may have accidentally overlooked or couldn't have accounted for, such as their output looking different when inputted into AG vs. when directly outputted in their terminal.. . This, along with the ice storm last week + the one predicted for tomorrow, has led to a lot of unexpected difficulties for many students.. . Again, I really appreciate all has been done to help us out so far. In light of all this, however, I wanted to ask if there was anything the staff team was planning to do to address the overlap in the time frame between p3's anticipated extended deadline and the midterm.. . Thank you!
i_answer: We appreciate the feedback, and we're sorry for the ongoing issues. This is something we've considered and informs our decision to extend until Friday 3/10 at 8pm so that there are a couple days after the midterm to get it turned in and sort out any last issues. (Canvas announcement going out in just a moment about this.)

subject: euchre.cpp erroneous input checking
content: Hi, . It is unclear to me via the spec how exactly to handle erroneous input, since there are no direct examples. When we get erroneous input or a file that can't be opened, should we still be printing back the executable beforehand, or no? Attached is an example of what I mean. Right now, we are printing the executable before we check for the input file error (but after the other input errors). Thanks!
i_answer: If you encounter some sort of error like the file not being open or the strategies not being Simple/Human etc, then you should only print the error message and nothing else.

subject: Size of deck to use Pack::shuffle()

subject: Assertion failed: string_to_suit
content: Hi! I tried to run the test50 on my euchre.cpp, and it worked at first, as all the output are printed.. However, after I changed some codes in my euchre.cpp to adjust the outcome of scores, it suddenly did not work. And I got the message saying: Assertion failed: (false), function string_to_suit, file Card.cpp, line 73.. . . . I wonder in this case, what I can do to fix this. I tried to use the debugger but I don't know how to set the breakpoint to Hand3.
i_answer: Your debugger should pause at the failed assertion _without any breakpoints_. Try running this program in the debugger as-is, then when it pauses, click on each item in the call stack (bottom left in VSCode) and inspect the variables in each stack frame for what went wrong.

subject: euchre_test01 hand 1 Fran trick 4
content: . Diamond is ordered as trump. Since Fran can't follow suit, shouldn't she play the lowest card which is 10 of Spades?
i_answer: Since the trump suit is diamonds, the Jack of Hearts (left bower) is technically a trump card/ a diamond. In this case, Fran can follow suit because she has 9 diamonds, so she plays that card.

subject: Fix the problem of memory leak
content: The autograder says that it detects problems of memory leak in my Player.cpp. What is the way to fix it?

Also, you may have a memory leak because you are creating the players in the player factory, but you are not deleting them in the euchre file. I think the best way is the sanitizer because it allows you to follow the problem.

subject: reading in names help
content: Hi, I am having trouble checking for argv for the names in the game . This is without a check but I also fail name checks in my main. . any help regarding any of this would be greatly appreciated!
i_answer: Start with error checking in the order described in the spec (i.e. number of arguments, points to win, etc).. . Once you're certain all errors have been checked for, you know what positions in `argv` each name and strategy should show up in. So, get the name/strategy pairs from those positions in argv and create a `Player*` object with that pair, and do this four times.

subject: euchre_test01 Hand 2 Gabriel
content: Hey!. . I wanted to ask about the logic behind Gabriel ordering up in Hand 2. No one has ordered up yet, so the add and discard shouldn't have been invoked, but it seems like he is invoking it, adding a King of Diamonds to his hand, and then ordering up?.  . Our output looks like the following.. .  . . Would appreciate any help :)
i_answer: I think it could be either a bug in your make trump function or your deal function in the driver. Make sure add_and_discard is only called if someone ordered up during the first round of trump making. . . For the deal function, Gabriel may not have been dealt the correct cards so he's not ordering up when he should be. Try using the debugger to see if everyone is being dealt the correct cards. If not, it's likely a problem in the deal function in the driver or the shuffle function in Pack.

subject: question about reading another pack.in file written by myself

i_answer: It might be that because there are newlines at the end of the file, it is reading in an extra time, causing you to index out of bounds. . . I would also recommend to use the >> operator you created for your card class.. . Lastly, you might want to not show the code for the entire function, at that might be an honor code violation.

subject: P3 Make Trump Rules Clarification Question
content: I was wondering if someone could help me clarify this potential test case:. . Let's say that the upcard is Ace of Diamonds. Let's say I have a hand with the Jack of Diamonds and Jack of Hearts. . . When calling the make trump function on a simple player for make_trump(upcard, false, 1, order_up), the function should return true because there are at least two face cards with the same suit as the upcard (Jack of Hearts is left bower and therefore also considered a Diamond). . . But, if i were to call make trump this way -> make_trump(upcard, false, 2, order_up) where it is the second round, should I be returning true or false?. . The game should never reach round 2 with this simple player hand but I am using it to find potential bugs in my make trump function and checking to see I am including the right cards as cards of the same color when it is round two.
i_answer: In the second round you would return true. The simple player would consider the card of the next suit which is hearts. They only need one diamond, and they have 2 (left and right bowers) so they would make trump hearts.

subject: Error in running make euchre.exe
i_answer: Try `make euchre.exe` without the dollar symbols in front

subject: Game constructor error. Error states that the constructor is inaccessible.
i_answer: Make sure that your constructor (as well as everything else you want to access outside of the class) is public. If you didn't add "public:" anywhere within your class, by default everything is private.

subject: euchre_test01 add/discard
content: I noticed that in hand 0, Edsger (the dealer) picks up the 9 of hearts. According to the correct output, the 10 of diamonds is discarded. Based on the google doc, I thought the jack of clubs would be discarded because that is the lowest card with the trump suit considered. I think I am either missing a rule, or the cards are being dealt wrong. Does anyone know what the issue may be? Thanks!
i_answer: If your dealer is picking up the 9 of hearts, that means that heart is your trump suit. Neither 10 of diamonds nor jack of clubs are of the trump suit, so we can ignore that when comparing. You first check the rank of the card, and jack is a greater rank than 10, so you would discard the 10.

subject: Error in euchre driver; incomplete type isn't allowed when using Game as a declaration.
i_answer: Make sure you don't have any functions within the class which are pure virtual, or don't have definitions anywhere.

subject: euchre_test.00 why does Barbara order up
content: I'm really confused why Barbara is the one that makes trump in euchre_test00. This test has no shuffling on pack.in, and Barbara is to the left of Adi, so she be getting cards 4-5 and cards 13-15, for a hand consisting of:. . Queen of Spades. King of Spades. Nine of ClubsTen of ClubsJack of Clubs. . The upcard is jack of diamonds, so once round 2 comes she is the first to decide if she wants to order up. Since she is a simple player, she shouldn't order up because she does not have a face or ace of the next suit of the upward (Diamond's next suit: heart), yet she does?? Not sure if I have the incorrect order of players getting dealt card of choosing to make trump or not or what. Appreciate any help :)
i_answer: The first player to get cards is the player to the left of the dealer. So if Adi deals, Barbara gets cards first meaning she has cards 1-3 and 11-12.. . (via the spec): Each player receives five cards, dealt in alternating batches of 3 and 2. That is, deal 3-2-3-2 cards then 2-3-2-3 cards, for a total of 5 cards each. The player to the left of the dealer receives the first batch, and dealing continues to the left until 8 batches have been dealt.

subject: play program
content: Not very relevant to the project but is there an easy way to use the project program to actually play a live game of euchre?
i_answer: You can use command with all four players being human. A drawback is that all players can see each other’s cards. To actually build front ends that communicates with this program (the backend) requires significantly more work.. . You could potentially clear the terminal after a player's hand is shown and they select a card, and then have it print out a message like "please pass the computer to the next player", and it only continues once that is done (for example, it waits for you to press enter or input 'done' or something)

subject: Euchre test_01: trouble figuring out incorrect output
content: Hi, my partner and I have been looking through our pack, card, player, and euchre files to figure out why we're getting the wrong card in the hand of Edsger, who is the dealer for hand 0. Every other card is outputting correctly for every other player for hand 0, however Edsger's card is wrong. I was wondering if anyone can take a look at our files and help us figure out why this might be happening. We believe that the error resides in our shuffle function in pack. Thanks! . Screen_Shot_2023-02-27_at_6.06.10_PM.png. .
i_answer: Other teams with a similar error have found that something was wrong with their use or implementation of add_and_discard() - that would be where I would start. For hand 0, notice that Edsger is the dealer. This means that when Fran orders up, using the SimplePlayer add_and_discard strategy, Edsger should pick up the upcard (Nine of Hearts) and discard the lowest card in his hand (Ten of Diamonds).

subject: Edsger Hand 0 Issues
content: Hey!. . My partner and I were looking through euchre_test01. We've been able to pass the other two tests, but, for some reason, we've noticed that the final card in Edsger's hand in Hand 0 is incorrect. We're confused on what may be wrong in our shuffle function, as it worked correctly in all other players and in the other two tests.. . We would definitely appreciate any help you could provide :)
i_answer: Along with the shuffle function, I would also consider taking a look at the add_and_discard() function. For hand 0 in euchre_test01, Edsger is the dealer. When Fran orders up Hearts in round 1 of trump making, Edsger adds the upcard to his hand and discards the lowest valued card in his hand (following the Simple Player strategy). In the case of Hand 0, Edsger should add the upcard (Nine of Hearts) and discard the lowest card in his hand (Ten of Diamonds). Hope this helps!

subject: Would someone explain why I am gettin this error?
content: . . And when I do is >> card; it works but i'm pretty sure I need to read out the rank and suit..

I would also take another look at how you handle the junk "of" characters. We cannot use a string literal as a place for the input stream to dump the unnecessary characters; we need to define a junk string variable instead. This will be very similar to Image_init function in p2 that needed to discard unnecessary characters from the PPM file.. Follow up with any additional questions!

subject: question about playing tricks
content: If the trump suit is Spades, and person A first led the Jack of Hearts, and another person B has Ace of Hearts and Ten of Spades. According to the simple player strategy, which one should the person play? If the person plays Ten of Spades, which is one of the trump cards, will this person beat the led person A? Since the value of trump cards are larger than the led suit, but this process requires players to follow the suit, I'm really confused about that.
i_answer: A player must always follow the led-card suit if they are able to. In your example, the led card suit is Hearts. Since person B has a card that follows the led card suit, they must play it. Therefore, person B plays the Ace of Hearts. It is only when a player does not have any cards that follow the led card suit can they play cards of different suits. For a simple player, if they are not able to follow the led card suit, they should play the lowest valued card in their hand.I am not sure if this answers your question so feel free to follow up if there is any more confusion.

subject: euchre test 01 questions (Fran's Jack of Hearts vs Ace of Hearts)
content: In the scenario I am stuck on in euchre test 01, Fran only has Jack of Hearts and Ace of Hearts left. The led card is Jack of Spades, and the trump suit is Hearts. From my understanding, the Simple Player should play their lowest if they do not have any cards of the led suit. With this logic, Jack of Hearts should be played. However, Fran plays Ace of Hearts in actuality.. . Additionally, Jack of Hearts is the right bower here, and I'm unsure how that is supposed to play into it. I think I am missing something in regards to the rules for simple player.
i_answer: Jack of Hearts is the right bower of this hand, i.e. the highest-value card in the game, so Fran should play the lowest card in their hand which is Ace of Hearts.

subject: Error declaring ifstream variable
content: . I am receiving an error in the declaration of my ifstream variable infile yet I do not believe I should be, the code is as follows.... . . //Project UID 1d9f47bfc76643019cfbf037641defe1. . #include "Player.cpp". #include "Card.cpp". #include "Pack.cpp". #include <iostream>. #include <cstdlib>. #include <fstream>. #include <array>. . using namespace std;. . int main(int argc, char *argv[]){.     string fileName = argv[1], mix_or_not = argv[2];.     string player0Name = argv[4], player1Name = argv[6], player2Name = argv[8], player3Name = argv[10];.     string player0Type = argv[5], player1Type = argv[7], player2Type = argv[9], player3Type = argv[11];.     int winningPoints = atoi(argv[3]);. .     if((mix_or_not != "shuffle" || mix_or_not != "noshuffle") || winningPoints < 1 || winningPoints > 100.     || (player0Type != "Simple" || player0Type != "Human") || (player1Type != "Simple" || player1Type != "Human").     || (player2Type != "Simple" || player2Type != "Human") || (player3Type != "Simple" || player3Type != "Human")){.         cout << "Usage: euchre.exe PACK_FILENAME [shuffle|noshuffle] POINTS_TO_WIN NAME1 TYPE1 NAME2 TYPE2 NAME3 TYPE3 NAME4 TYPE4" << endl;.         return 0;.     }. .     ifstream infile;.     infile.open(fileName);.     if(!infile.open()){.         cout << "Error opening " << fileName << endl;.     }.     Pack deck_of_cards(&infile);. .     return 0;. }.
i_answer: You are just slightly off in one of the function names. To check whether an ifstream is associated with a file, you should use infile.is_open() rather than infile.open(). Additionally, I would check the argument you are passing to the Pack non-default constructor. Is the Pack non-default constructor expecting the address of the ifstream?

subject: Use break in a loop
content: In lead card and play card function, are we allowed to use break in a for loop? If I don't do this, I will have a deep nested loop
i_answer: Yes, you are allowed to use "break" in for loops. A common way to fix deeply nested code is to write helper functions.

subject: Euchre Public Tests
content: I received the following error message for my Euchre public tests: "Error opening noshuffle." I inputted the arguments in the order shown below (./euchre.exe being argv[1], pack.in being argv[2], noshuffle being argv[3], and so on...), but it thinks that I am trying to open noshuffle as an input file. Would any instructor be able to look at my code?.
i_answer: Check that you are using the correct command line argument number for the pack input file name. Command line arguments are passed into your main function through an array of c-style strings - char*[] argv. The first element, argv[0], contains the name of the executable (euchre.exe). The fifth element, argv[4], contains the name of the first player (Adi). Think about what element of argv you need to access for the pack input file name.

subject: Player.cpp redefining Class Player...and errors from unit_test_framework
content: I am having these errors I don't know how to not make it defined again and if I were to remove the "class Player" it says another error about the fact there are virtual functions. Also, I am getting these weird errors because it is not reading right from the unit_test_framework and I have not made any changes to that particular file, so there shouldn't be any errors.. .
i_answer: Did you declare a class called Player in Player.cpp (indicated by the firs error)? You are not supposed to define a Player class in Player.cpp since it is a virtual class. What you should do is define classes called Simple and Human that inherit from the Player interface. I suppose the error in your player tests would be resolved if you fix your class definitions.

subject: shuffle
content: During hand 1 of euchretest01, the correct card is being turned up at the beginning of the hand but the players don't have the correct cards in their hand. I don't think its a problem with the pack shuffle function or the deal cards function because in hand 0 all of the cards were shuffled correctly and each player got the correct cards. After the first hand and shuffle, the correct cards are being turned up in each following hand but the players are still getting the wrong cards so im not really sure where to look. Anyone else have this problem or know where to look to try to fix it?
i_answer: If in hand 0 all cards are dealt and played correctly by all players and that the upward in hand 1 is correct, it has to be either your shuffle or deal cards function. I would check and see if you have called shuffle in between each round, and if the role of the dealer has moved one player to the left.

subject: UB Checks
content: I got 69/69 on autograder but I failing these UB Checks, and I saw someone say they have address sanitizers on and i just set it up and fixed some long unsigned int errrors, but i resubmitted to autograder and I am still having the same issue..
i_answer: I don't think any test data in this project will need long long or unsigned int types. Failing undefined behavior check means that your program is likely to have going out of bound error or having a memory leak. While you get 69/69 in public tests, it is possible that you will fail some of the private tests. Given that all euchre tests failed UB Check, you might want to check if you deleted all your player pointers at the end of the program.

subject: Question about assertion
content: Hi, I have a question about assertion in my code. I can successfully run my code and get the same output of the three tests in my terminal. But I can't pass autograder because it shows that my assertion failed. I wonder the reason behind this since I didn't get assertion fail massage from my terminal.. .
i_answer: Autograder uses gcc while MacOS likely uses clang as compiler backends, so it is possible for some program to run on Mac fine but fails in autograder. Without looking at your code it is not so easy to diagnose the problem, but here is a potential reason why your code fails on autograder: I assume you are using a vector as container for handCard, so the .size() method returns an unsigned int as its size. It is possible that static_cast converts in a weird way and behaves differently in gcc. I believe you don't need static_cast for the return of .size() when comparing with a regular int, so try to remove static_cast and see if autograder passes.

subject: Player not compiling it autograder
content: Not only does player pass all public test cases in xcode, it also passes self-written test cases regarding human and simple player. I'm confused on why it won't even compile in the autograder.
i_answer: Where the compilation warnings are, click on player.cpp. Give it a couple seconds to load (won’t appear immediately), and then a description should appear. Where it says “Error output: “ and there is a chunk of code, it should reveal the issue. Usually from what I’ve seen, it’s just some single minor issue that will allow your code to work on your end, but Autograder doesn’t like it that way. (Ex. I forgot to do #include <cassert> once and had assert statements which worked fine on VScode but not Autograder)

subject: Priniting make_trump
content: So I understand the output:. Adi deals. Barbara passesChi-Chih passesDabbala passesAdi passesBarbara orders up Hearts. . But should this be the same output in the case of screw the dealer? Would the output be: . //indicating round 1. Adi deals. Barbara passesChi-Chih passesDabbala passesAdi passes. //indicating round 2. Barbara passesChi-Chih passesDabbala passesAdi orders up hearts.
i_answer: Yes - except for the fact that Adi can't order up `Hearts` if that was the suit of the upcard. The screw the dealer mechanism states that the dealer must order up a suit other than the rejected suit. See [here](https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#round-two) for more information.

subject: rules questions
content: Just some questions about the smaller details of the rules:. . Does the lead card change every time a trick is taken?. . Is it intended for all players to have one card left by the fifth trick?
i_answer: Yes. The lead card is just the first card played in each trick. . Yes. Each player should be playing one of their five cards each trick, so they should be left with only one by the final trick.

subject: euchre.cpp error in output

I recommend using your debugger to step through the code. I would make sure players are going when they should be, that they have the correct cards in their hand. You can also track the variable you believe is causing the loop to run an extra time.

subject: Duplicated Code
content: I made a sort function that accounts for trump suit, but I have it such that I use it in both simple and human player. However, when I make this a private member function in both derived classes, auto grader says there are too many lines of duplicated code. I'm not sure how to resolve this.
i_answer: Your sort function does not have to account for trump suite and SimplePlayer does not have to have a sorted hand. Also, the sorted nature of the hand only considers the relationship defined by the < operator.. . https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#human-player : See section "adding the upcard and discarding".. . subject: autograder output is different from VS code output
content: When I test my code in VS Code, I get the correct out put for test00 and test50. When I submit it to autograder, it says my output is different and completely wrong. Anyone know why this happens?
i_answer: * You can use local sanitizers to detect undefined behavior (the students' answer), memory leaks, and illegal memory access. [Here](https://eecs280staff.github.io/tutorials/setup_asan.html) is the setup guide for sanitizers.. * You can upload your project to CAEN and rerun your tests there. The CAEN environment is the same as the autograder, so it is more likely to replicate the autograder's output. [Here](https://eecs280staff.github.io/tutorials/setup_caen.html) is the setup guide for CAEN. (You can enable sanitizers on CAEN as well.). * Ensure that you are using `ifstream` to read `pack.in`, not `fstream`. `fstream` requires both read and write permissions to `pack.in`. Both your local environment and CAEN will allow you to write to `pack.in`, so `fstream` would work fine there, but the autograder won't allow you to write to `pack.in`, so `fstream` would fail on the autograder. You have to use `ifstream` instead, which only requires read permissions.

subject: trump in euchre
content: If any player orders up, the upcard’s suit becomes trump and the dealer is given the option to replace one of their cards with the upcard. How do I check if the dealer wants to pick up the upcard and discard one from theirs?
i_answer: After someone orders up in the first round of making trump, you _always_ call `add_and_discard` on the dealer. If the dealer wants this option, they would take the upcard and discard a different card from their hand. If they don't want this option, they would just ignore the upcard.

subject: player_tests.cpp false positive confusion
content: I have a false positive that I know is in this test case I wrote, but I really don't know where. I reread the rules for SimplePlayers when playing a card, and I debugged the code following the player's hand to make sure the correct card was being played, but I don't see where the issue is. Everything seems correct. I would appreciate any guidance. The code is below, thank you.. .
i_answer: For play_card, a simple player plays the highest card that follows suit, otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand. At the start of the test, you add the Jack of Diamonds and the Ten of Diamonds to AI-2's hand. You then ask AI-2 to play a card given the trump suit of diamonds and a led card of the Ten of Diamonds. Since both cards in AI-2's hand at that point follow the led card suit of Diamonds, AI-2 should play the highest of the two which is the Jack of Diamonds.

i_answer: You shouldn't need to account for repeated cards in Player.cpp or euchre.cpp, i.e., you can assume that there will be no repeated cards in a player's hand. However, you cannot assume that the cards passed to `Card_less` and `operator

subject: Euchre error
content: . class Game {. . private:. vector<Player *> players;. Pack deck;. Card upcard;. . . Card upward is erroring with variable "Card" is not type name. . I have card.h included at the top, why is this happening?
i_answer: There could be multiple reasons. Like the student mentioned, you may want to double check the you put Card.h file under the same folder. Also since the name of the class is "Card" not "card", whenever you create a card, you should use "Card c" instead of "card c". Sometimes trying to remake exes can help (in your case it would be make euchre.exe). You can also try closing your IDE/Editor, and reopening it. The IDE/Editor is not always smart enough to find the path to the files, so the last two "solutions" is asking it to restart from the beginning and try to find the files.

subject: euchre_test50.in Possible Issues
content: In the file euchre_test50.in for testing Human player, I noticed two things. . . 1. from lines 30 to 50 there seem to be 21 inputs, but a game only needs 20. . 2. on line 34, the number is 4 which would be out of bounds. . Is there something wrong here? please advise. . thank you!. .
i_answer: 1. There are 21 inputs from lines 30 to 50 because in this hand the trump is decided in the first round, which necessitates the extra input from the dealer for them to choose which card to discard. Then the game continues normally with 20 inputs. This doesn't happen in the previous hand because trump making reached round 2, therefore there is no input needed from the dealer. . 2. In line 34, the 4 is not out of bounds here because the input in this case is asking for a card in that players hand, which ranges in input from index 0 to index 4, therefore 0,1,2,3,4 are all inbounds.

subject: question about euchre
content: I got the same result in hand 0, but when I work on hand 1. the turned-up card is different, which is two spades. I don't know why. And for the shuffle function in the euchre.cpp.  Do we only need to reset when it is noshuffle? since I think the reset() function is in the shuffle.
i_answer: You need to check how you are choosing the upcard at the start of each hand. You might be defining it only once and then after hand 0 it becomes a default card.. . You need to reset the pack at the start of every hand, whether it is noshuffle or shuffle.

subject: Play card.
content: Hello, I am so close to passing all test cases for this project. I am failing one part on euchre_test01.. . Essentially what is happening is that there is a situation where on Hand 1 trick 4, Fran cannot follow suit of the led card and plays the lowest card in their hand. They play a trump card however. I was under the assumption that if a player cannot follow suit they should play the lowest card considering trump which would not be a trump card right?. I play the ten of spades and the auto grader expects a nine of diamonds. Diamonds is trump. I have rewritten my play card function a few times now and I cant seem to make any changes that solve this issue. Any help and advice would be very appreciated.Here is my code.. . .    Card play_card(const Card &led_card, Suit trump){.         assert(hand.size() > 0);.         //play suit of lead card (highest).         //if none suit then play any card.         vector<Card> trumps = get_trumps(trump);.         Card play_card;.         vector<Card> cards_of_lead_suit;.         if(led_card.get_suit(trump) == trump){.             //vector<Card> trumps = get_trumps(trump);.             if(trumps.size()> 0){.                 play_card = trumps[trumps.size() - 1];.                 //play_card = trumps[0];.                 adjust_hand(play_card);.                 return play_card;.             }.         }.         //loop thru cards.         for(auto &c: hand){.             //if same suit.             if(c.get_suit(trump) == led_card.get_suit(trump)){.                 if(c.is_left_bower(trump)){.                     trumps.push_back(c);.                     continue;.                 }.                 cards_of_lead_suit.push_back(c);.             }.         }.         if(cards_of_lead_suit.size() > 0){//if they can follow suit play the highest one.             sort(cards_of_lead_suit.begin(), cards_of_lead_suit.end());.             play_card = cards_of_lead_suit[cards_of_lead_suit.size()-1];.             adjust_hand(play_card);.             return play_card;.         }.         //play the lowest value card considering the trump card.         //and the suit of the lead card.         //find non trumps.         vector<Card> non_trumps = get_non_trumps(trump);.         if(non_trumps.size() > 0){.             play_card = non_trumps[0];.             adjust_hand(play_card);.             return play_card;.         }.         //if deck is all trumps then return lowest trump;.         sort(hand.begin(), hand.end());.         play_card = trumps[0];.         adjust_hand(play_card);.         return play_card;.     }. Thanks in advance.
i_answer: That euchre_test01 is pretty tricky. For hand 1, the trump suit is Diamonds. On trick 4, Edsger leads with the Jack of Hearts, which is the left bower. Since the left bower is considered as the trump suit, Fran must play her only card that follows the trump suit which is the Nine of Diamonds rather than the ten of spades. Hope that helps! Follow up with any additional questions.

subject: Code duplication
content: What does code duplication mean in the style section and how do I fix it?
i_answer: For example, you may find that the second Card_less() has a lot of similar functionalities compared to the first Card_less(). If you choose to copy and paste some code fond the first one into the second one, you may get "code duplication". In this case, you should consider how to call the first Card_less() in your second Card_less() to avoid using duplicate code.. In general, duplicate code may make a file longer than it should be, less efficient, and more difficult to maintain. Using a helper function to take care of the chunk of duplicate code is another common solution.

subject: Strange error when trying to run euchre.cpp
content: Hi, after implementing euchre.cpp I tried to run it in the terminal, but I got this weird error. What is a "new-expression"? Why are the Player functions being treated as virtual ones?.
i_answer: It looks like you are creating an object that is abstract, which is not allowed in cpp. Player is an abstract class because it has at least one member function that is pure virtual. A pure virtual function is = 0 rather than has {/*implementation*/}. If you haven't implemented every function in Simple player, it will also be abstract because it will inherit the pure virtual function.  Remember that you can only create Player * because you are not actually creating a player object itself. For more information on this, see the Player.cpp section of the P3 FAQ (@1463).

From there you can go back in the call stack and look at all the variables to see what memory is being accessed and why it might be invalid. For more information on the call stack, see our debugging guide (https://eecs280staff.github.io/tutorials/debugging_guide.html). . . For the Euchre Public Tests, I took a peak at your code in the autograder. It looks like you are printing "Error opening file" instead of running the program. Make sure you are using the is_open function to check if a file is open (https://cplusplus.com/reference/fstream/ifstream/is_open/).

subject: euchre_test01 - Players Have Incorrect Hand After Hand 0
content: The error I am getting is that the hands of the players in Hand 1 are incorrect. I have tested to make sure that this is the correct issue. I printed the content of the pack after it was shuffled and manually dealt the cards to the players to see what the exact issue was. The cards in the pack after the shuffle was not in the correct order. I am not sure why the pack after shuffling would be wrong, since the shuffle worked correctly for the first hand. I have been trying to figure out this issue but I cannot seem to find the answer.
i_answer: Looking at your shuffle function in Pack, it looks like you are shuffling half the deck 7 times, then shuffling the other half of the deck 7 times. This is an incorrect implementation. It could be possible that by chance it worked the first time.. . A correct implementation creates a copy of the cards. The cards array is going to be overwritten with the card order. You can use the copy of the cards array to remember the original locations of each card before you started overwriting the cards array.. . When thinking about the actual overwriting during the shuffle function, I would try mapping the current index of the card and then the index of the spot you want it to end up in. You will see that there is a possible mapping so you can write cards[new index] = cards_copy[old index].. . Hope this helps!

subject: FALSE POSITIVE
content: On the autograder, this test comes up as a false positive. Assuming our implementation is correct, what is the issue in this? Is this case possible?. . . We have submissions in the autograder. Uniqname: taitelee
i_answer: The jack of spades is the left bower, meaning we consider it a club. Keeping that in mind, player jihong can and has to follow suit because the lead suit is clubs and jihong has a club. The jack of spades should be played in this instance, not the ten of spades.

subject: False Positive
content: Does having a false positive in our test cases take off a point on the autograder?
i_answer: A false positive does not take a point off, however it does not gain you any points and it also indicates that there is something wrong in your code. A false positive is a test case that is written wrong, meaning it asserts the incorrect answer. It passes on your code, though, because your code also returns the incorrect answer.

subject: shuffle
content: . void Pack::shuffle() {. std::array<Card, 12> temp1;. std::array<Card, 12> temp2;. for (int i = 0; i < 7; ++i) {. for (int x = 0; x < 12; ++x) {. temp1[x] = cards[x];. }. for (int a = 12; a < PACK_SIZE; ++a) {. temp2[a] = cards[a];. }. for(int s =0; s < 6; s++){. cards[s] = temp1[s];. cards[s+1] = temp2[s];. }. next = 0;. }. }. . This keeps returning Two of Spades != King of Clubs. was wondering how I could start to fix? Kinda stuck (unique name = finnward if you need it)
i_answer: From what I am reading, there might be a few issues:. 1. In the last `for` loop, `card[s+1]` will be overwritten when `s` increments in the next iteration. 2. In the last `for` loop, only 7 cards in your original pack are updated, instead of all 24. 3. You'll need to call `reset` at the end of the function. . I highly recommend reading the students' and instructors' answers in @2314: try writing your shuffle function based on a small deck of cards first (the one on Wikipedia is really helpful) - try out different methods, and see if your output matches with the correct one.

subject: lead_card function
content: I still can't get exactly how I can structure my program for lead_card function. i_answer: I think you're sort of on the right track. You would want to divide this into two cases: (1) there is at least one non-trump card, and (2) all cards in the hand are trumps. Then within each of these cases, you want to use `Card_less` to compare your current card with the max card you've read so far.

subject: P3 Deadline Extended to Sunday 3/5 at 8pm
content: The project 3 deadline is extended until Sunday 3/5 at 8pm. We understand the ongoing autograder issues have been impacting your ability to work on project 3. subject: How To Account for Whether Human or Player functions will be called in euchre?
content: This question is the biggest stump I've have. (may be a bit long, please forgive me). . - Would we have to derive two instances of the game driver to account how the game will run if we have simple players and how the game will run if we have human players?. . - If so, or somewhat along those lines, should we pass in a parameter that indicates that all players are either human or player? My point in doing this is to pass in their argument so then I can hard-code in my implementation: . - Ex: If argument given to function is "Human", execute only printing who won the trick and not the other players and what card they play like Player does. . . - To distinguish which functions from Player.cpp need to be called, would we also utilize putting (Human::) or (Player::) by the functions we need to indicate to the compiler which ones to use?. . Mini-Question: I basically created a .h file with RME's to help GSI/Professors/Peers understand my code and how my functions work/their sole purpose. Would this run into any error since I've created it for my driver?
i_answer: . Would we have to derive two instances of the game driver to account how the game will run if we have simple players and how the game will run if we have human players?. . No, the game should run the same (same functions will be called for each player). Differences in how players act are handled within the player functions.. . .  If so, or somewhat along those lines, should we pass in a parameter that indicates that all players are either human or player? My point in doing this is to pass in their argument so then I can hard-code in my implementation:. Ex: If argument given to function is "Human", execute only printing who won the trick and not the other players and what card they play like Player does. . . Since the previous answer is no, this doesn't really require an answer. However, note that a game can be played with both human and simple players. It is not required that all players are human / all players are simple. Also, printing should be handled inside the human player functions.. . . To distinguish which functions from Player.cpp need to be called, would we also utilize putting (Human::) or (Player::) by the functions we need to indicate to the compiler which ones to use?. . No. You are calling the functions on an object, so you would just call functions normally (if player1 is a pointer, then player1->function() and if player1 is a value then player1.function()).. . . Mini-Question: I basically created a .h file with RME's to help GSI/Professors/Peers understand my code and how my functions work/their sole purpose. Would this run into any error since I've created it for my driver?. . You cannot submit the .h file, so this is an issue. You should only be editing files which you are submitting, because edits made in other files / new files created will be completely ignored by the autograder. This is unless you want to just have like a cpp file for testing, like Pack_tests.cpp - you can still implement that since it will test your code, and does not affect anything.

subject: Initializing Player Vector
content: I am trying to initialize my player* vectors using this logic:. . players[i].push_back(Player_factory(name,strategy));. however, my error reads:. . . . . std::__1::vector<Player *> Game::players. . . . . . expression must have class type but it has type "Player *"C/C++(153). . Why does this strategy not work?. .
i_answer: players is a vector of pointers, so players[i] is a pointer to a player.. There are two things wrong with your code.. First, you need to do players.push_back(...) instead, since you are pushing into the vector, not into the pointer.Second, if you were trying to access a player function you would need to use -> instead of . since that's how you access a function of a pointer.

subject: add and discard function for simplePlayer
content: Hi,I’m confused that if we should call make trump inside add_and_discard function, as the spec said the simple player would pick the up card if they are dealer in the first round.In this case, should we use the if statement to set condition for the add_and_discard function? That is, only add and erase card when make_trump is true.Thanks
i_answer: make_trump returning true does not indicate whether you are in round 1 or 2. It will return true whenever the player wishes to make trump (i.e. if they say yes to the upcard I round one or if they choose a suit in round 2).Also, you cannot call add_and_discard inside of make_trump because make_trump is const.What you need to do is just return true/false in make_trump based on whether or not the player makes trump, and then in euchre.cpp, you can check if it's round 1 or 2. If it's round 1 you call add_and_discard but if it's round 2 you don't.

subject: tips for play_hand()
content: any advice for how to start play hand would be so greatly appreciated :(.
i_answer: You could implement this in multiple ways. One strategy would be to make variables to keep track of who is playing, starting with the leader, and keep a vector of cards played in a round. When a round starts, the leader will play a lead card and add this to the vector. From there, iterate through the remaining players and have them each play a card. Finally, determine what card was the highest. Winner then becomes the leader, and you would do this 4 more times, keeping track of who won more tricks. You will also have to add to the total scores at the end of this.. . You can split this up into however many functions you believe makes the most sense for you, then call them within play_hand() and/or play() and/or other related functions. . . Hopefully this helps!

subject: Printing out hand for dealer
content: Hi I am having trouble understanding the logic and how to implement it onto my euchre.cpp. I understand that if the player other than the dealer makes a trump, then it would change the trump and print out the dealers hand if it is human player, however how would I print out the dealers hand in the player.cpp/euchre.cpp when the function is just print_hand(). Would I set the name to something? I am a little confused behind the function of print_hand().. . EDIT: i think i understand it now
i_answer: For anyone else coming across this, you don't need to call print_hand inside euchre.cpp. If the trump is chosen during round 1, then you should just call add_and_discard for the dealer, and you can print the hand in there.

content: In Hand 2 of the euchre_test01, it says that Edsger has to follow suit but I don't understand why. The led card's suit is Hearts and both of the cards that Edsgar has are diamonds and from my understanding, since Hearts != Diamonds, he cannot follow suit.

subject: Setting Up a Debug Session
content: I'm running into a segmentation fault when I run euchre from the command line and I'm not sure how to set up a debug session on X code when the command line is used to run the program. . . If I'm correct I need to use input redirection to use a file as my program input, instead of command line input, but I'm having a hard time figuring out how to do that. Any help is appreciated!
i_answer: First make sure you checkout these two sections(passing arguments and input redirection) so you set up debugging for euchre.exe correctly.. . My suggestion is to set a breakpoint on the first line of main(). Then press continue and xcode will automatically stop when an abort message pops up, such as seg fault. Then you can view something called the "Call Stack" in your Xcode debugger (you have to look around a bit to find it).. . The call stack will show you the most recent function calls. Trace those function calls to see what function caused the segfault. Then start debugging that function.

And it’s for the same reason because there are a couple of different cases you’d need to consider.. . Also generally try to have at least 1 test for each function.

subject: Changing Dealers
content: Hi! . Can someone give me an idea of how to change dealers after each hand? Originally I had it so that the order of the entire players vector changed (so that players[1] becomes players[0] and so on). But I'm debugging right now and doing it that way is causing issues with the order of the names printed. . . Let me know! . Thanks
i_answer: I personally used a private member variable to keep track of the dealer index and incremented it by 1 after each round (and corrected to keep it between 0 and 3 if need be). . Just an addition to the answer above, the easiest correction to keep within bounds is just to modulo the dealer position by 4.

subject: question about making trump round 2
content: if my upcard is heart, and in round two I have Jack of diamonds. does Jack of the heart is considered a left brewer, and then order up by diamonds
i_answer: . . . . . . if my upcard is heart, and in round two I have Jack of diamonds. does Jack of the heart is considered a left brewer, and then order up by diamonds. . . . . . . In round two, you would consider the suit of the same color as trump, so in this case diamonds. If you have one face card of this suit, then you will order up (per simple player strategy). And yes, jack of heart will be considered a card of the diamonds suit.

subject: make_trump
content: If making trump reaches round 2, the player's do not pick up the up_card, correct? they only choose whether to make the next suit trump?
i_answer: Only the dealer ever picks up the card, and they only do so during the first round. During the second round they choose what suit they want to be trump, and don't pick up the card.

subject: player play_card tests
content: Hi I am having a false positive register with the test below and I cannot understand why. It works on my code which makes me assume that my function is not working properly, some help would be greatly appreciated.TEST(test_player_play_card2) {    Player* laura = Player_factory("Laura", "Simple");    laura->add_card(Card(NINE, DIAMONDS));    laura->add_card(Card(JACK, DIAMONDS));    laura->add_card(Card(QUEEN, SPADES));    laura->add_card(Card(KING, SPADES));    laura->add_card(Card(ACE, SPADES));    Card ten_diamonds(TEN, DIAMONDS);    Card card_played2 = laura->play_card(        ten_diamonds,  // Nine of Diamonds is led        HEARTS    // Trump suit    );    ASSERT_EQUAL(card_played2, Card(JACK, DIAMONDS));    delete laura;}
i_answer: Jack of diamonds is the left bower, so it counts as a trump card (aka hearts suit). You have to follow suit, and the suit in this case is Diamonds. So, you will play ten of diamonds.

subject: deal in driver
content: Do we have to create a hand for each person and then deal the cards with that?
i_answer: You should have an array of players. In player.cpp, there should have been a private member variable for a person's hand, so when you make your 4 player array, you should have 4 hands already.

subject: test cases for player
content: does anyone know how the points for the student simple player test mutation works? Is it the more test cases there are, the more points you get? I know we're only testing the simple player function.
i_answer: there are 17 bugs for you to catch. if your test case catches one bug, you get one point. if you have a false positive, you lose one point. it doesn't really matter how many test cases you have - it depends on how many bugs those test cases can catch.

subject: simple player make trump confusion
content: in the specs, it says "During round two, a Simple Player considers ordering up the suit with the same color as the upcard, which would make that suit trump." this is going to sound like a very dumb question, but i'm confused as to what "same color" means. if the upcard is diamonds, are all the cards with the same color all the hearts and diamonds, or just the diamonds? thanks!
i_answer: If the upcard is diamonds, the simple player will only consider ordering up hearts, and will do so if they have at least one face card with hearts as the suit.

subject: linker error

subject: Wrong upcard when not shuffling in pack.in simple player example
content: My partner and I have been consistently running into an issue when running example games using pack.in when there is noshuffle. When there isn't a shuffle called, the pack stays the same, and we upcard the first card in the deck. In the pack.in file, the first card in the deck is 9 of spades. However, in the spec, the jack of diamonds is turned up. We are confused why this is the case, as we were not supposed to shuffle the deck because of the noshuffle input. . . Not sure where to locate the issue with this!. . .
i_answer: Make sure you deal before you reveal the upcard.
