subject: Euchre 01 test
content: The card that my player plays on the second round of the first trick doesn't match with the correct output. I'm not sure if this is because the cards aren't shuffled correctly. If the player has ace of spades, jack of spades, nine of hearts, king of diamonds, and the ledsuit is spades and the trump is hearts, what would the player play? I thought the player should play jack of spades but the correct output says that it should be ace of spades.
i_answer: The simple player aims to play the highest card that follows suit if possible. In this case, the player can follow suit. And because ledsuit is spades, but trump is hearts, ace of spades ranks above jack of spades (as jack of spades is not the same color as the trump suit, it has a lower value than queen/king/ace).

Your player tests are run with buggy versions of code and should be independent of your player.cpp implementations. If you have version control, maybe check to see what changed from the last submit to this submit.

subject: what is the equivalent of CPPUNIT_ASSERT_MESSAGE forunit_test_framework?
content: I can't find it.
i_answer: I don't believe the unit test framework has an equivalent. However, if you run tests through command line, it should give a stack trace, and if you use a debugger, it should give you the state of your program when the assert does fail.

subject: Game constructor initializing private member variables
content: My game constructor has one parameter that is a vector of string objects that will be read from argv. However, I also have private member variables like ledCard and upCard that are initialized privately. I keep getting an error that tells me to define these variables in my Game constructor. When I do this I get an error that says my constructor still "provides no initializer".
i_answer: What do you mean by initialize privately? If you mean that they are initialized directly in private, then that might be causing an issue. Your private member variables are like blueprints, you haven’t actually made the Game class yet and they can’t be assigned values since you don’t have the Game object. So in your constructor, you probably want to call them and set their values to some default value since that’s when you make the Game object and give your values

subject: random algorithm file?
content: I got errors on a random algorithm file that is not included in my files under p3-euchre. I have no idea what this file is - can i just delete it? could relate to @2195 my post earlier about not being able to run player public tests. . .
i_answer: Algorithm is a library for the C++ Standard Library that you are including in your files. You do not need to delete that file, and it is not locally on your computer.. . Your IDE may show you that the error is in a Standard Library function but those errors will stem from somewhere in your own code - in this case somewhere where you are calling sort in your local files. You can use the debugger call stack to figure out what is calling sort.. . One common error that I would check is if you are sorting your hand vector in any const member functions. Recall that sorting changes the hand member variable which is a compiler error.

subject: When to use get_suit() vs get_suit(trump)?
content: It seems like for the most of the time, we should be using .get_suit(trump) when comparing cards. This way, the left bower is taken into account right? (such as in card_less, etc.). . But, is the basically only time I would just use .get_suit() be when I'm returning the suit of the upcard, for example? Here I wouldn't really need to consider left bower stuff since I just want to actually return the suit it says.. . I think the usage/not usage of this is causing some issues while debugging, so I just wanted to check in.
i_answer: They key distinction when using these functions is whether the trump suit exists in your context. When using .get_suit(), the trump suit is not determined yet, such as in the make_trump() function. When using get_suit(trump), the trump suit is provided and has an impact on the rest of the game, so you would be using this function anywhere after make_trump.

i_answer: Your Pack::shuffle function looks generally correct to me. In your euchre.cpp shuffle function, are you passing the pack variable by reference? If it were passed by value, your pack variable would not reflect the shuffle once the function returned.. . If you are already doing this, I would step through with the debugger to make sure the cards and next index in your pack are getting updated. This is based on the fact that the Jack of Diamonds is what should be returned if no shuffle took place at all.

subject: make_trump in Game
content: Hi,. . I'm getting a really weird error while running my make_trump function in the driver file. I have a vector of the players, and I loop through, calling make_trump (from the player file) on each of them. However, the make_trump function doesn't seem to be called for the fourth player. The index of the player doesn't matter, just whenever make_trump (from the player file) is called for the fourth time, it won't work and gives me an address sanitizer error. Does anyone know what may be wrong? If you need clarification on the question, let me know.
i_answer: You called get_upcard() function when you call make_trump() for each player. And your get_upcard() function erase a card from your remaining_card array. First of all, you remaining_card array should only have 4 cards at the begining of the make trump process, after you erased 4 of them, there's nothing there and that's what causing the error. Second of all, your understanding of the make trump process is not correct, the players should use the same upcard the each round of make trump. I suggest you to read through the spec about make trump again.

subject: Adi keeps ordering up Diamonds with Pack.in
content: No matter what we have changed, my partner and I cannot determine why Adi keeps ordering Diamonds. We printed out the count of good cards he has when the simple player decides to make trump, and it returns 3, meaning he has 3 good cards and should order it up. But, the example in the spec says he passes round 1.
i_answer: Adi has three trump, but they could be non-face/ace.. . Copied from spec:. "During round one, a Simple Player considers ordering up the suit of the upcard, which would make that suit trump. They will order up if that would mean they have two or more cards that are either face or ace cards of the trump suit (the right and left bowers, and Q, K, A of the trump suit, which is the suit proposed by the upcard). (A Simple Player does not consider whether they are the dealer and could gain an additional trump by picking up the upcard.)"

subject: euchre.cpp shuffling
content: In a game like euchre_test01 that has several hands and the “shuffle” argument, do we shuffle the original pack that was input at the beginning of each hand? Or do we take the same pack from the previous hand and shuffle that?
i_answer: Same pack from the previous hand otherwise shuffling the original pack would always result in the same hands being created (dealt to different players or the same exact players having the same exact hand depending on who won the previous hand)

subject: Error compiling Player
content: We need help understanding the error messages compiling Player.cpp. We aren't sure if this is a technical formatting issue or just an issue in implementing one of our function or even Player Factory.. . .
i_answer: "Invalid new-expression of abstract class type 'SimplePlayer'". . It's telling you that SimplePlayer and HumanPlayer are abstract classes, meaning you haven't implemented all the functions from Player.h.

subject: Question about euchre_test01
content: . . In line 21, it says: "Nine of Clubs played by Gabriel". Unless my deal or shuffle is wrong, Gabriel has the Jack of Diamonds which would be played over the Nine of Clubs for a simple player. Am I misunderstanding this or is my deal or shuffle not working correctly?. . . . .
i_answer: Jack of Diamonds could be a possible left bower (if trump is Hearts) so maybe somewhere in Simple Player you’re not considering for left bower/trump. Remember the left bower is not the suit of its suits’ name, it’s the suit of the trump.

subject: Not sure what errors are occurring in Player
content: I'm not sure what errors are occurring with my Player.cpp because it is not giving specific compiler errors but it is saying have undefined references?? And when I attempt to run it, it say no such file exists. .
i_answer: When you run make, it's giving you the error that there's an undefined reference, so it stops creating an executable, which is why the executable doesn't exist.. . The undefined reference error says you haven't defined operator<<(std::ostream&, Player const&), which is defined in Player.h. Make sure you implement this funcion in Player.cpp.

subject: cannot use terminal to test player_public_test
content: I cannot seem to test my player.cpp at all on terminal and i am worried. can someone please tell me what is wrong with what i did. i do not think it has to do with my code since i cannot even make the test correct? this is the end and the start of the huge error i get when i run "make player_public_test.exe" on my terminal:. .

subject: bus error in make trump in the game class. Stops because of a cout << "something" ??
content: In my Game class function in euchre.cpp, I have a function that runs through the trump making phase. after the trump is chosen and the terminal correctly displays ____ orders up ____ << endl << endl; I get a bus error. The next line after the order up cout function is a cout << "check"; that I put in for testing purposes. However, after completely and correctly printing out the first line including the two endlines, it doesn't print the "check" and I get a bus error. From what I read online, bus errors can happen from endlines, but when I tried removing the endl from the first line, I don't even print it and I just get a bus error one line earlier. Changing the endl to \n doesn't work either. All the logic I used is relatively trivial, and my partner and I have already ran test cases on Player::make_trump and the other necessary functions. I just don't understand where the error is coming from.
i_answer: Segmentation faults occur when your code tries to access memory somewhere that the CPU cannot access (ex: accessing an index of an array that is greater than its size). I would suggest looking through any loops you have in euchre.cpp that maybe be accessing memory incorrectly

index < hand.size();index++) {                        if (hand[index].get_suit() == led_suit) {                /*if (led_suit == trump) {*/                                if (hand[index].is_left_bower(trump)) {                    Suit_next(hand[index].get_suit());                    continue;                }                if (hand[index].is_trump(trump) && tempcard.is_trump(trump)                    && Card_less(tempcard, hand[index], trump)) {                                                                        index_card = index;tempcard = hand[index];                    continue;                                        }                                if (hand[index].is_trump(trump) && !tempcard.is_trump(trump)) {                                            tempcard = hand[index]; index_card = index;                    continue;                }                if (tempcard.get_suit() != led_suit) {                    index_card = index;tempcard = hand[index];                    continue;                }                /*}*/                if (tempcard.get_suit() != trump &&                     Card_less(tempcard,hand[index],led_card,trump)){                                            index_card = index; tempcard = hand[index];                        continue;                }                if (tempcard.get_suit() == led_suit                     && hand[index].get_suit() == led_suit &&                     operator>(hand[index],tempcard)) {                    index_card = index; tempcard = hand[index];                }                .             }            // checks as well to see if there            // any forms of trump then pushes it back                    }        if (index_card == 55 && led_suit == trump) {            if (tempcard.is_left_bower(trump)) {                Suit_next(tempcard.get_suit()); index_card = 0;            }                    }        // if there are at least one number        // that is the same as the followed suit        if (index_card != 55) {                        hand.erase(hand.begin() + index_card);            return tempcard;        }

subject: lead/play_card() - indexing question
content: I am wondering if each card in a human player's hand has a permanent index, or if that index changes based on previously played cards. In the second hand of euchre_test50.in, Kunle first plays the Ten of Clubs (index 3), and then the card at index 4. Theoretically, after they play the Ten of Clubs, there should no longer be an index 4 (the size of their hand is now 4, max index = 3). Is the card at index 4 supposed to retain its original index, or is there an error in the input file?
i_answer: The spec says to use sort whenever a player adds a card to their hand, so I believe the answer would be no, the exact card doesn’t maintain its original index (since, like you said, the size of the hand changes throughout the game)

subject: makeTrump for Simple player
content: i'm trying to test my function and i may be confusing myself, but i have a question about make_trump() for simple players.. . if we're in round 2, i know the specs say that the player will order up the suit with the same color as the upcard. will they order up if they have one or more cards that are either face or ace cards of the trump suit in their ORIGINAL hand or if they will have one or more cards that are either face or ace cards of the trump suit in their hand AFTER ordering up?. . .
i_answer: Their original hand and hand after ordering up will be the exact same. They won't pick up the upcard or anything like that. I do believe you should consider the suit that the trump would be if the player makes trump when deciding to make trump.

subject: test50 - why does Judia and Liskov only have 1 point after Hand 1?
content: In hand 1, Judia deals and orders up.. Judia's team win 4 out of 5 tricks and ordered up, so shouldn't they be winning 2 points after hand 1?. Yet test50.out.correct shows. . . 305 Judea and Liskov win the hand306 Ivan and Kunle have 2 points307 Judea and Liskov have 1 points. . . I thought you win a point if you win, 2 points if you won and ordered up, and 3 if you marched and ordered up.. . Or is my understanding of scoring incorrect?
i_answer: It seems your understanding of scoring is incorrect, from the project spec :. . "The team that takes the majority of tricks receives points for that hand. If the winning team had also ordered up, they get 1 point for taking 3 or 4 tricks, and 2 points for taking all 5. Taking all 5 tricks is called a march. If the winning team did not order up, they receive 2 points for taking 3, 4 or 5 tricks, which is called euchred.". . Basically you can only earn one or two points at a time, . 1 point: if your team called trump and you won 3-4 tricks. 2 points: your team won all 5 tricks or the other team called trump and you won 3+ tricks

"std::basic_istream<_CharT, _Traits>::basic_istream() [with _CharT=char, _Traits=std::char_traits<char>]" (declared at line 606 of "/usr/include/c++/9/istream") is inaccessible. . Has anyone else gotten this? Does anyone know what this means, or how to fix it?
i_answer: It's hard to tell with what you've given. The rest of the error message should give some better context. Just make sure you use an ifstream for the pack and #include <fstream>. It might be good to come to OH for this if that doesn't help.

subject: copying a pack
content: Is it possible to write pack1 = pack2. . where both pack1 and pack2 are Packs.. Would this cause every card in pack1 to equal every card in pack2, or is there another way we would have to go about setting one pack equal to another pack?
i_answer: This works, you can set one instance of a class equal to another instance of the same class and it will copy over all member variables as well.. . Additionally, since Pack uses a C++ `std::array` for the cards, when that's copied over it will automatically copy the cards as well. This is in contrast to a C-style array, with which you would have to copy the cards yourself with a for-loop, for example. But with a C++ array it does it for you :)

subject: question about add and discard
content: if trump make in the round 2, does dealer need to add and discard based on upcard?.
i_answer: You will only need to call add_and_discard if trump is made in the first round. After the first round the upcard is "turned over" and the dealer can no longer pick it up.

subject: Command line arguments failing
content: int main(int argc, const char * argv[]) {.     if (argc != 12) {.         error_print();.         return 1;.     } else if (atoi(argv[3]) < 1 || atoi(argv[3]) > 100) {.         error_print();.         return 1;.     } else if ((string)argv[2] != "shuffle" || strcmp(argv[2], "noshuffle")) {.         cout <<(string)argv[2];.         error_print();.         return 1;.     } else if ((string)argv[5] != "Simple" || (string)argv[5] != "Human") {.         error_print();.         return 1;.     } else if ((string)argv[7] != "Simple" || (string)argv[7] != "Human") {.         error_print();.         return 1;.     } else if ((string)argv[9] != "Simple" || (string)argv[9] != "Human") {.         error_print();.         return 1;.     } else if ((string)argv[11] != "Simple" || (string)argv[11] != "Human") {.         error_print();.         return 1;.     }. .
i_answer: Take a look at your validation for shuffle/noshuffle again. If the argument is "shuffle", then the second part will be true, and the error will print. If the argument is "noshuffle", then the first part will be true, and the error will print.

subject: Next index
content: When we pass out the cards, 20 cards are given to the players and the 21st card becomes the upcard. What would happen during the second round? Would we want to use the original card pack? If then, wouldn't we set next to 0 whenever it gets past 21 instead of pack size?
i_answer: . The dealer shuffles the deck at the beginning of each hand.. . . At the beginning of each round, the pack should be reset and possibly shuffled.

subject: private class members in constructors
content: If I have private members in my game class like upcard, ledcard, trump, etc. should those things be initialized to like any random card or suit or integer in the game constructor as good style? Because I have them initialized in other helper functions when the upcard and ledcard etc are determined naturally in the game, but I wanted to know if its required to have every private data type initialized in the constructor.
i_answer: If you do not specifically initialize an instance of a class, it will call the default constructor - in this case even if you do not set the upcard to a specific card, it will initialize to the two of spades (assume your Card.cpp is implemented correctly). You can initialize the variables if you want, but they will be initialized based on the default constructor anyway.

subject: Make_trump for Player
content: Just wondering but in round 2, say the upcard is a Diamond, that meant the next suit is a Heart. Does the Jack of Diamond count as a face_or_ace for the next suit in addition to the rest of the Heart face cards?
i_answer: If you are asking about make_trump, Jack of Diamonds would count as a trump face or ace for both hearts and diamonds. This is because when diamonds is trump, Jack of Diamonds is the right bower, and when hearts is trump, Jack of Diamonds is the left bower.. . As the instructor said face_or_ace only checks if the card is J,Q,K,A though.

subject: What's core tests?

If it's being slow to run all of the tests, it's likely due to the error mentioned @2131 . This feature is so that people are able to make multiple submissions when the AG is under a high workload

subject: Segmentation fault when accessing derived function
content: All the functions in Player is virtual, and all the functions in SimplePlayer has been implemented. The players.at(1) works fine, although I am not sure if it has been downcasted or not. If not, how to fix it? Pic 1 is a bunch of codes with the terminal that reports the error of segmentation fault at the bottom, Pic2 is the pic of my code for making players.(FYI I players.size() is 4. . . .
i_answer: Changed visibility to private since you're sharing a lot of code. It looks like many people have viewed this. Please don't do this again.. . Generally, questions like these that involve showing a lot of code warrant coming into OH. I saw the error pretty quickly, but still come into OH in the future if you have questions similar in nature to this.. . In your Game ctor, when you add Player pointers to the players vector, you're deleting the player immediately, so the player can't be accessed. Then, if you access the player at any point, you're trying to use memory that you've deleted, which results in a segfault.

subject: false positives
content: whats the best way to correct false positives? I checked the tests i created that autograder indicated there was a false positive and it looks right and should be working.
i_answer: False positives mean that your tests reported error when running against a correct implementation. If you don't know which test is causing the false positive (maybe you have multiple tests within one function), try submitting without suspicious tests and see if false positives reoccur. If you know which step is causing the false positive but don't know why it causes error, it is possible that your implementation does not 100% follow the spec and there may be a bug.

subject: Play Card testing
content: I'm trying to test play_card, and I have a question. Say the trump suit is hearts, the led card is the nine of diamonds. . If a simple player were to have :.   bob->add_card(Card(NINE, SPADES));.   bob->add_card(Card(TEN, SPADES));.   bob->add_card(Card(ACE, DIAMONDS));.   bob->add_card(Card(JACK, HEARTS));.   bob->add_card(Card(JACK, DIAMONDS));. . then they would play the left bower (jack of diamonds), correct? It is the highest card that follows suit of the led card (diamonds) because it is the left bower of the trump suit (hearts) and therefore has a greater value than the ace of diamonds. OR, does the Jack of Diamonds not count towards following suit of the led card because it is considered in the trump suit (hearts)? Thanks
i_answer: The left bower is considered a card of the trump suit.

subject: Euchre_test_01 Gabriel for the second trick
content: So I have read the instructions on how to play and I think that there is something wrong in the output correct of this test because of this rule.. . And this, in Simple Player instructions.. . The error that I see is that Gabriel is not supposed to play the nine of clubs but instead the Jack of Diamonds because Edsgar played the King of Diamonds. So by these rules of following the suit and that the trump is the hearts, then therefore Gabriel would win this trick because he had to follow suit.. . This one is mine : (below).
i_answer: Recall that, if trump is heart, then the Jack of Diamonds is a bower, so it is considered to be a heart.. . Because of this, Gabriel cannot follow suit, they must play the lowest card in their hand.. . Hope this helps!

subject: assigning function return value to variable
content: I write a piece of code like this:. . . leader->lead_card(trump);. . . But then I want to assign this value to a Card variable.. . Which version of code would I write?. . 1.. . led_card = leader->lead_card(trump);. . 2.. . leader->lead_card(trump);. led_card = leader->lead_card(trump);. . ---. . . . Would the second piece of code run the lead_card function twice? But will the first piece of code even run the function and remove the lead card from the Player's hand?. . Sorry if my question is confusing. Let me know if I need to clarify my question further.
i_answer: In (1), you're calling the function and saving the return value into led_card. If lead_card removes a card from the hand, then a card will be removed from the hand.. . In (2), you're calling the function twice, so yes, the function will be called twice. If the function removes a card from the hand both times, then 2 cards will be removed from the hand in total.

subject: Adding and discarding after Making Round 2, trump suit does not match upcard suit.
content: The function SimplePlayer::add_and_discard() in Player.cpp, to my understanding, should add the upcard to the cards that a simple player is holding, judge which card is the least valuable, and remove the least valuable card.. . In the context of euchre.cpp, this function is called after the trump suit has been made. If the trump suit was made before round two of making, then some player must have ordered up the suit of the upcard, meaning that the trump suit will be the suit of the upcard. Now, the dealer must add the upcard to their hand and discard the card of least value. The value of the cards in their hand is judged in the context of a trump suit existing---that trump suit being the same suit of the upcard. This is works great.. . I am running into a dead end when considering how to evaluate the value of the cards in the dealer's hand when the trump suit is determined in round two of making, i.e. when the made trump suit is not the suit of the upcard. Inside the scope of SimplePlayer::add_and_discard(), only the upcard is passed in. Where previously we could assume that the suit of the upcard is the trump suit and judge the value of the cards based on that, we can no longer do so, as the trump suit that has been decided and is something different, presumable the next suit of the same color.. . How, then, should I resolve this issue? I could make a global suit type object to represent the current trump suit and call Card_less() inside of add_and_discard() using the global suit in place of the trump suit. I could change the parameters of add_and_discard() to include a suit object and pass in the trump suit that is decided in the scope of make_trump(), but I don't want to run into issues with the autograder. I can't write an alternative function because there will be no precedent to override in Player.h.. . Sorry, just very confused.
i_answer: In the second round of making, you no longer need to consider add_and_discard(). The dealer only adds the card during if the trump is made on the first round.

subject: Do we have to call the first card_less function inside the second one? - Card.cpp
content: We failed the code duplication on AG because our codes for both card_less functions have pretty similar implementations at the beginning of each function. Do we have to call the first card_less function inside the second one to avoid this error? Can we create a private function helper to replace the similar code in both of the functions?
i_answer: You can call the first cardless in the second if you want, but you’ll need to consider when you can call it. . . And yes, you can create a helper function to replace the code duplicate. This is actually even good practice. Do remember to declare them static too.

subject: Why isn't argc being read correctly?
content: When I run my euchre.cpp, with this command:. ./euchre.exe pack.in noshuffle 1 Adi Simple Barbara Simple Chi-Chih Simple Dabbala Simple. . The first thing I get for argc is 3. I'm not sure what I could be doing/changing that impacts argc already? Argc is the first thing I check, to make sure the value is 12. . . And I don't believe I need to convert the int argc to anything else?. Any ideas/similar problems would be really helpful!
i_answer: The initial value of `argc` is determined by the operating system as it loads this program, so we know for sure that at the instant when `main` begins running, `argc` is equal to 12. To isolate the cause, you could try writing:. . ```cpp. #include . int main(int argc, char** argv) {.   std::cout << argc << std::endl;. }. ```. Compile this into something like `argc_test.exe` and then run `./argc_test.exe pack.in noshuffle 1 Adi Simple Barbara Simple Chi-Chih Simple Dabbala Simple`. If the output is not 12, then the way you run those commands or the command-line shell might be at fault.. . (I know that the office hours queue will be excruciatingly long, but we would need to diagnose your environment further if the above steps don't help)

subject: Printing a pointer (Conceptual)
content: Hello, just a conceptual question but I noticed in the public test for player insertion, this was the format:. . EST(test_player_insertion) {. // Create a Human player. Player * human = Player_factory("NotRobot", "Human");. . // Print the player using the stream insertion operator. ostringstream oss1;. oss1 << * human;. Since the overloaded Player insertion operator takes the address of a player, shouldn't our tests be oss1 << human instead of oss1 << *human? Why are we deferring here? .
i_answer: The overloaded insertion operator takes a reference to a Player, not an address.

subject: game::make_trump()
content: I was wondering how different is the make_trump in game from the one in player. I understand that it is void and we probably have to check for each player to see if they want to make trump, starting with the one from the left of the dealer. But, I'm not sure how to go about it. Since it's void, should we pass a player parameter and if a player decides to make trump, we set it to the player?. . I was also confused about making trump in round 2. I know for round 1, the 21st card is the up_card. But if they all pass the first time, do we check the 22nd card? I am not quite sure about this part. . . Any help would be appreciated.
i_answer: The functions given for the Game ADT are merely suggestions. You can change the parameters and types of the functions. But in general, you'd want a make_trump which loops through all four players and sees if any of them want to make trump (and do this for two rounds). . . The Player `make_trump` function takes in a round number as input, so just putting in the right number there will handle what suit the player is considering, assuming it's done correctly in the Player `make_trump`.. . Speaking of which, the simple player strategy is to consider the suit of the upcard on round 1, but to consider the *next* suit of the upcard on round 2 (i.e. the opposite suit of the same color, see `Suit_next` in `Card.h`)

i_answer: Hard to tell without seeing your code, so maybe submit to autograder and have an instructor take a look, but here are some suggestions, from most likely to least likely:. . When you do something like pack[0] = pack[1], now, pack[0] and pack[1] are both equal, and if you did pack[1] = pack[2], now all three of them are equal. So, you can't just move the array around like that. You either need to use temporary variables to store the value of cards, or you can make a second array and just add cards into that, and then replace the original one.Are you ever assigning more than one at a time (for example, did you accidentally write something like pack[1]=pack[3], pack[2]=pack[3])How are you moving the cards around? No new cards should be made, only the locations of cards should be switched.. It's probably the first one, but if not maybe you can describe how you implemented it (without sharing too much info, just generally) in the followups and I can try to help..

subject: Segmentation fault pack istream_ctor
content: uniqueID : lrsierra. . So our pack.cpp file was passing the autograder tests until our last submission. We have not changed it since, but now there is a segmentation fault and we are not sure what is wrong. I ran the debugger through the given public tests and that passed. However, if I try to run all the public tests there is also now a segmentation fault.. . . . . . . . . . . .
i_answer: Try setting `next` to 0 in the istream constructor. Not initializing can result in it being initialized to junk, which means that the code can sometimes work and sometimes not (undefined behavior)

subject: Simple Player: Is Leading Card Suit is a trump after the first trick?
content: At the beginning, make trump is a SPADES.  after player 1 win the trick, player 1 lead the next round with Queen of Heart.  Is Heart become a trump card now or do we still follow the SPADES from the beginning until all cards are played in that round..
i_answer: Spades stays the trump for the whole hand (1 hand = 5 tricks). The led suit changes every trick.. . So no, the trump is still Spades until the next hand starts and the cards are redealed.

Undefined behavior happens at runtime and is the result of bad coding practices (e.g. indexing out of bounds, leaking memory).. . It seems like you haven't implemented your == and

subject: Unusual Empty lines in euchre_test01.out.correct
content: I used the sdiff to compare my output (right) to the correct output (left) in euchre_test01.out.correct. There are two extra empty lines after "Herb passes" in Hand10. However, there are not supposed to have two empty lines there when I just read the euchre_test01.out.correct. The empty lines give me some extra errors.. . This is what I got from using sdiff to compare output:. . . This is the screenshot when I just pull up the euchre_test01.out.correct:.
i_answer: There aren't actually two empty lines there, its just showing that to make space for the extra lines you printed in your output file. Let me explain:. . Here is a guide on what the symbols mean. So for yours:. . . It looks like some changes earlier in the file caused your lines to be mismatched. So sdiff corrects this for you. ) means that only the second file contains the line, but the difference is ignored. The reason it does this is to be able to line up the two lines that are actually different (the ones connected by the third red line). So | denotes that the two lines are different.. . Also, it looks like you have an extra whitespace after "Edsger orders up Clubs", which is what > means.. . So, summarizing, your only differences (from this screenshot) are:. "Edsger orders up Clubs" should be "Edsger orders up Spades"there is an extra line after "Edsger orders up Clubs". And then you also have some differences earlier in the file.

subject: Pack changes when I set it to another pack
content: Hi! For pack.cpp in my shuffle program I have a line of code. . . std::array<Card, PACK_SIZE> copyCards = cards;. . . I would think that normally this would create another set of cards with the same value as cards named copyCards. However there are some weird cases like this:. . . . This is making me have a bunch of exceptions when running shuffle..
i_answer: You can't set arrays equal to each other in this way. You have to instead loop through one array and copy each individual Card into the other. You can, however, do something like Card copycard = card;

subject: who is the dealer?
content: My understanding of this game is that player 0 is the dealer for the first hand, and then player 1 is the dealer, then player 2, etc., until the game is over. Is this correct?
i_answer: yes the dealer keeps rotating 0-1-2-3-0-1-2-3 etc until the end of the game

subject: Simple game strategy
content: Hi if there is a scenario where the trump is SPADES, led card if TEN of SPADES, and we have JACK of DIAMONDS and JACK of CLUBS in hand, would we play JACK of CLUBS since it is a lower value and because JACK of DIAMONDS doesn't follow the suit of the led card?
i_answer: Yes, but not because Jack of Clubs is a lower value.. . First, you check if you can follow suit. If you can, you play the highest value in the suit. Jack of Clubs is a left bower, and so it is actually part of the spades suit. Jack of Diamonds is not in the suit so it is not considered. So you are only allowed to play Jack of Clubs.. . Now, just to explain this fully, let's say your led card was ten of hearts. Then, you can't follow suit, so you play the lowest card. So you would play the Jack of Diamonds, since Jack of Clubs is more powerful (since it's the left bower).

subject: human test cases
content: do we need to write test cases for humans in order to catch some of the bugs?
i_answer: You can create human players and test their names for example, but there is no way that you may control what the human player wants to play in the game. However, you can write your own human player test cases to test your own code locally.

subject: Command Line Testing
content: Should testing for the number of arguments and type of arguments being passed in be done in main? Or is this supposed to be done in the game class?
i_answer: That's a design choice and is completely up to you.

subject: Initializing pack from file in game driver
content: Hi,. . I am confused on how I should be reading in the pack from an input file. I have already declared a Pack object as a private member variable within the Game ADT, but the only way to read in a pack from input is to initialize a new object. The way I have written it so far is I have a function that initializes a new Pack object from the file, then copies the contents of that object into the private member Pack. Is this a proper way to read in the pack or is there a more elegant way? Let me know if any clarification is necessary.
i_answer: You should find a way to utilize the custom Pack constructor that takes in an istream argument. The logic to get to that point should be similar to how we used ifstreams in p2.

subject: play_card: if the remaining hand is all trump cards, do you play the highest or the lowest card?
content: I am getting a false positive error on the autograder for my play_card function. My code plays the lowest trump card if the entire hand is trump cards, although the spec says to play the lowest card in the hand if there are none of the led suit. When the hand only has trump cards, should I play the highest or the lowest card?
i_answer: Follow the spec exactly as it says, if the led suit and trump are not equal, play the lowest trump. If the led suit and trump are equal, play the highest card.

subject: Few questions about methods used.
content: I was wondering if to make life easier we would be allowed to create an int within the player classes so that we can tie score/amount of tricks won to player to then be summed up later in the game ADT, as well as a way to keep track of which player made trump by putting a boolean within it. . . Also, was wondering if instead of keeping track of who was the dealer/leader if we were allowed to have a set dealer/leader position and then rotate the players through that one position. rather than move the dealer position.. .
i_answer: You are allowed to add any member variables and functions to the Game ADT that you'd like. The design is up to you, as long as it gives the correct output without undefined behavior

subject: What is in the pack when it's Hand 1?
content: When there is more than 1 hand, what is the card pool of the pack? Are we using the original pack?
i_answer: The original pack is used throughout the entire game; at the end of each hand, you'll reset the pack with the provided method, and before each hand you will shuffle the same pack (assuming "noshuffle" was not entered as one of the game options).

I went to office hours and thought I had solved it but the fixes did not end up making any changes. Any suggestions on where to look for the root of the issue or what our problem may be would be super helpful. Thank you!.
i_answer: Note you've created a player pointer that has specified the strategy and the name of that player. Once you've read in a pack of cards, you need to need these cards to each players hand. What function do the player classes contain that might help you here?

i_answer: Found this answer online, maybe it will work: Set the environment variable MallocNanoZone to 0.. . Here is how you set environmental variables in Xcode.

subject: keeping track of player
content: I am having trouble keeping track of what player's turn it is:. . Is there an easy way to keep track of what index in the players vector the dealer and rest of the players are? I also need this for trick taking because I am struggling with how to know who is the leader and how to go to the next three people in order.
i_answer: Try saving the index of the leader every round, then you use the modulus operator to find who goes second, third and fourth.. . For example, say the leader is index leader_index in the vector. Thus, you can use. second_player = (leader_index + 1) % 4;. to find the index of the player who plays the second card.

subject: Can .h files be modified/Euchre player types
content: I'd like to have the player type easily accessible for ease of implementation, so I made a private member variable for each class called type (it's a string), and added a get function for it. Only problem is that it won't compile unless I add the function stub into player.h. Is this ok to do? I assume it won't pass the autograder as we don't submit the .h files but I'm not sure how else to store the types unless it's in a vector of strings but that'd be a pain.
i_answer: You cannot make changes to Player.h. Also, why do you need to store the types? The coolthing about inheritance/polymorphism is that once you create the objects, you can just treat them as the base class without having to implement any derived-class-specific logic. Further specializing would likely make your implementation more complicated.

subject: SimplePlayer play_card strategy confusion
content: I'm a little confused about the SimplePlayer strategy for the play_card function. Say a simple player has an Ace of Diamonds, Ace of Clubs, Jack of Spades, Ten of Spades, King of Spades, and a Ten of Clubs in their hand. Trump is Clubs and the suit of the led card is Clubs. Clubs is trump, so the Jack of Spades is left bower. Since the led suit is Clubs, would a simple player play the Jack of Spades (since it is kind of Clubs due to it being left bower) or the Ace of Clubs, since it is directly Clubs?. . Thank you.
i_answer: They will play Jack of Spades. For game purposes, left bower is considered to be of trump suit. . . Side note: max card per hand is 5

subject: Code Duplication Error from Player.cpp classes
content: I'm receiving a code duplication error from my two separate classes within player.cpp. I defined each of the header files twice in the public sections of the separate classes. I was told by a TA that this should not produce an error. What should I do to fix it?. Thank you so much!.
i_answer: You're probably getting issue because the RME comments are also identical between the functions. If you remove the duplicated RME, then I think you may be all good.

subject: Segmentation fault in euchre.cpp, not sure where
content: I am getting a segmentation fault here, not sure where it would occur..
i_answer: It's hard to tell exactly what the problem is by looking at a picture.. The general strategy is: whenever you have no idea where the problem is, set a breakpoint at the very beginning of your main function(since this is where your program starts running) and step through your code. Once you hit a segfault, the program will halt and you know where the error occurs. And as to what causes this error, you could progressively move the starting breakpoint from the beginning to the line of failure, each time making sure a small region of code works fine and narrowing down the buggy region.

subject: Player Tests
content: I am trying to figure out which functions we need to write test cases for. I have written tests for make_trump, play_card, lead_card, get_name(), and add_and_discard(). Are those all the functions we need to test for player?
i_answer: You should try to write tests for each function that you implement in Player. There isn't really a requirement, but that's the best strategy when trying to catch all of the bugs.

subject: Confused on player.cpp functions
content: I tried reviewing the lecture notes on derived classes and polymorphism, the p3 specs and piazza posts but I am still confused. For the derived player classes (simple and human), are we supposed to implement each function with Player::, or are we supposed to be each function declaration in both derived classses, and then implement them with SimplePlayer:: and HumanPlayer::. Doing player:: and not having to put the function declaration in both derived classes makes more sense (because you would just be writing the functions the same way for both classes), but I saw some piazza posts that confuse me if that is true. Thanks!.
i_answer: You should not implement any function in the Player class as it is an abstract class and is only meant to be derived from.. . You should be creating a HumanPlayer and SimplePlayer class, both of which derive from the Player class. Then, for both SimplePlayer and HumanPlayer, you must at least implement all of the functions that are outlined in Player (because we derive from Player, and Player is an abstract class so we must implement all of them). You can add more functions if you see a need for them, but it's not required.

subject: euchre_test01: Autograder correct output questions
content: Why does Fran play the nine of diamonds first in this hand when she has a ten of spades? Shouldn't she be playing the ten of spades first since it is lower than the nine of diamonds (because diamonds is trump here)..
i_answer: I also made this mistake recently. Yes diamonds is the trump suit. This makes Jack of Hearts the left bower which is also a diamond. Thus, in Line 67 when Edsger leads Jack of hearts, the lead suit for that trick is actually diamonds, so Fran can follow suit, so she should play her Diamonds.

subject: How to fout the game
content: So I have created a lot of cout statements and I was wondering how am I supposed to output the game. Such as euchre_test01_out and others like that. How are we supposed to declare those as the name?. . Also should I use fout instead of cout statements in my game class?. If you have the second probably looking at my code in the autograder is better to understand what is happening than me sharing it here.. . Thanks!!
i_answer: You should use cout statements in your game class. I believe you are referring to input and output redirection, meaning that you can call your euchre game like . . ```. ./euchre.exe pack.in noshuffle 3 Ivan Human Judea Human Kunle Human Liskov Human  euchre_test50.out. ```. . This will use the `euchre_test50.in` file as the input for your game automatically and then output everything to the `euchre_test50.out` file (it will create the file if it doesn't already exist). Anytime that you use `cout` in your code it will either print to your terminal OR it will print to the file if you have specified.

i_answer: Resolved

subject: Is this a typo?
content: . Can someone explain to me how this is right? It's from the test01 correct output. At this point in the round, the trump suit is Diamonds, and Fran has two cards left, the Ten of Spades and the Nine of Diamonds. Edsger leads with Hearts, and since Fran doesn't have any hearts, as a simple player, she's supposed to play the lowest card in her hand. However, in the correct output, she plays her Diamonds card, which automatically trumps her Ten of Spades even though its number is lower.
i_answer: Even though it looks like Edsger leads with hearts, because it is the Jack of Hearts it's the left bower, and the left bower is *always treated* as if it were the suit of the same color (in this case Diamonds). So the led suit is actually Diamonds, and because of that Fran must follow suit with the Nine of Diamonds. This is a tricky one so let me know if you have questions!

". . Should we check for any other errors? For example, is it necessary to check that there argv[3] (i.e., the number of points needed to win the game) is in fact an integer?. . subject: Unknown Errors making player public test, but works on partner's computer
content: Hi,. . I'm running into the following error when trying to make player public test:. . . However, it works on my partner's computer. We've checked and the code is the same. Any tips?. . Thanks
i_answer: Take a look at the lecture notes, but when implementing a virtual function you don't write virtual, and before the curly bracket of the function you need to write override. For example, if I had a function called virtual Bird talk const in my bird class, then I would need to write in my chicken class which is like a derived class from the base class bird then I would write Bird talk const override { ...Implementation...} Also, the unused variable comes when you don't use the variable anywhere else, so you declare it, but you don't use it. Hope this helps.

subject: how to best compare the played cards?
content: In euchre.cpp, the players play the card that they want to (like with the card they want to lead, or playing a card for the other players).. . Would it be reasonable to create an array of the played cards, and out of these, see which one is the greatest value?
i_answer: It would be reasonable to store the played cards in a vector and compare. There’s also the option of just calling cardless every time and storing only the highest card. I think it comes down to a design choice. . . Also, for your follow up, yes doing !cardless works, but also do think about what happens if you swapped a and b. That basically tells you whether b is less than a, or in other words, a >= b.

i_answer: argv[1] is a c-styled string and not a c++ string. You need to cast argv[1] into a c++ string using something like string(argv[1]) and then assign its value to input_filename.

subject: Euchre_test01 upcard
content: I am confused on why the upcard is different from round to round. Even if the shuffle is on, shouldn't the upcard be the same throughout each round since we are resetting the entire game, just changing who the dealer is. So each player will get a different hand, but the upcard should be the same. Or am I missing something?
i_answer: You need to shuffle the deck before dealing at the start of each Hand. So, the upcard should be different because after each hand concluded, we don't reset and reshuffle the deck. BUT we continue shuffling the already shuffled deck.

Other than that, since all methods except play() should be private, I don't think you could really test it. subject: lead_card() simple player
content: If a simple player is leading the trick and has two off suite aces, which one should they choose to play? This might go all the way back to card_less in card.cpp, as in if we input two off suite aces that are not the lead suite and not trump then what should be returned?
i_answer: . When a Simple Player leads a trick, they play the highest non-trump card in their hand. If they have only trump cards, they play the highest trump card in their hand.. . . Since a simple player will play the highest non-trump card in their hand, they would play the highest ace in this case (D>C>H>S). Card_less would return either true or false, depending on which is lower than the other.

subject: card_less with led suit
content: What does it mean when the trump suit is equal to the led suit? Aren't the trump and led suits always two different things? And how does it work if the left bower is always considered the trump suit, wouldn't that just make it the right bower card? Thanks.
i_answer: The trump suit can be equal to the led suit since the led suit will change every trick but the trump suit will remain the same for the whole hand. The left bower is the Jack of the suit of the same color as the trump suit. So if the trump suit was hearts then the Jack of hearts would be the right bower but the Jack of diamonds would be the left bower, no matter if the led suit of that trick was diamonds, hope this helps!

subject: hand 1 in euchre_test01.out.correct
content: . I discussed this with other GSIs, and they also do not know what is going wrong on my side. Here, Fran has the card{(Q,C), (J,C), (K,S), (N,D), (T,S)}. The trump card is Diamond, the lead suit in 3rd trick is Hearts. The card is the same on my side as well as in the correct version. However, when we go to the 4th trick, something happens. In my logic, Fran should play (T, S), because (Ten of Spades) is less than (Nine of Diamond), because the Diamond is the trump card, so I need to play (T,S). However, the correct version play the (N,D), I do not know why. Just to note, everything same before line 68. Here is the picture: . . For the euchre01.real.out is my version, for the euchre_test01.out.correct is the test case you give us. If you do not think my fran hand holds the right card, you could compare each trick that Fran play except for the last two tricks. On top of that, for the last two tricks, fran just plays the wrong order of cards, which means he holds all five right cards.. Please explain to me why fran plays (N, D) in the 3rd trick.
i_answer: The jack of hearts is the left bower when diamonds is trump, so the jack of hearts is actually a diamond in this case. Fran would follow the suit of the led card, which is diamond, so she would play diamond.

subject: player_tests.cpp false positive
content: Hi, my unique name is gahyuny (i wasn't able to edit my name for some reason) I was wondering if you could look into my false positive cases. subject: (resolved)euchre_test01 Issue
content: I read this file explanation about euchre_test01.. euchre_test01 Explanation - Google Docs. The explanation says that the upcard is Nine of Hearts.. subject: question about euchre tests in autograder
content: I'm confused about the difference between Euchre public tests and Euchre public tests with Solution, Card, Pack, and Player in the autograder. The Euchre public tests are just the public tests that we can check by running our code and sdiff in the command line to check whether our outputs are correct. And we passed these tests. However, we couldn't see what public tests with Solution, Card, Pack, and Player are in the autograder and we didn't pass the tests. So what is the difference between these 2 kinds of tests and how to fix this problem?. .
i_answer: The first set of tests uses all of your files. The second set of tests uses the instructor solution for Card, Pack, and Player, but it uses your implementation of euchre.cpp. If you pass the former but not the latter, you're likely not respecting the interface for the Card, Pack, and/or Player files.

subject: Accessing derived classes from Player_factory
content: I’m having trouble accessing some functions I defined for SimplePlayer and HumanPlayer. I made both derived classes have playerHand, which is a vector of Card. I also made them private and made public getter and setter functions for both derived classes. When I tried testing them in my test cases, the instantiated Player pointer from Player_factory can’t use the getter and setter functions I defined in order to set the player’s hand and run tests. Is there a way I can access the functions in SimplePlayer and HumanPlayer through the Player_factory (while possibly not having to downcast the pointer to those derived classes)?. . Here's an example of the functions I have set up in SimplePlayer:. .
i_answer: Since we're using Player pointers in euchre.cpp, we can't access any members of Simple or Human players that don't also exist in Player.h without downcasts. I'd argue that this will make your euchre.cpp unnecessarily complicated, and you should be able to do everything necessary with just the Player functions. What is a case where a SimplePlayer's hand should be modified externally? And even if there is such a case, what would make it different from a HumanPlayer's use case?. . Also, if you expose a function setPlayerHand to be public, then you can modify the player's hand from pretty much anywhere, which becomes another thing to keep track of. It would be a lot cleaner to only modify the hand within the SimplePlayer class itself.. . Final note. Even if you wanted to use explicit downcasts in euchre.cpp, the AG may not even allow you to #include "Player.cpp", and then you won't have any way of accessing these extra functions anyway.

subject: euchre.cpp Player_factory
content: Would we call the Player_factory function in main to create each player, and then pass them through to the game constructor to make the vector of player pointers? If so, when we delete the players at the end of the game, would we have to delete the players in the vector and in main as well?
i_answer: When you use the delete keyword on a pointer, you are calling the program to delete the objects in the memory place where your pointer is pointing to. I personally would just create the players inside constructor for the game class and delete them at the end of play(). . . If you want to create player pointers outside of the Euchre class and pass them in, you can call on delete for each pointer at the end of the play() function, or you can delete the players after the game logic has ended and returned to main (but you need to keep a copy of those addresses so you can call delete on each of them at the end of the main function).

subject: card_less with trump
content: Hi! I had a question about what to do with this function when the two cards aren't both trump and have different suits. I know that in the game the led card's suit is bigger. But for this function specifically how should I compare the two?
i_answer: For same ranks, ties are broken by Spades < Hearts < Clubs < Diamonds. So first you would compare the ranks. If they have same ranks, compare the suits.

subject: Which functions within Player.cpp should have sorting within the implementation?
content: Hi, . . I'm seeing alot of Piazza posts about not being able to use sort within const functions. By reading over the print function, the provided code in the spec does not account for sorting. So, is this to say whenever we call the print function, we should call "std::sort(hand.begin(), hand.end());"before that. . . Also, for a guide, which functions should have sort() within them?.
i_answer: If you call a function to just print something, you probably wouldn't expect it to modify anything, right? So yes, to be able to print a sorted hand, it should be sorted before you call print.. . Really, though, when do you ever really need to sort it? If it's already sorted, then you don't need to sort it again. You really only going to need to sort when the hand is modified, right? But also, if you remove a card from a sorted hand and don't change ordering, then it should still already be sorted. That leaves one case for when you need to sort.

subject: debugging euchre.cpp
content: I'm confused on how to use the debugger for euchre.cpp. I can input arguments like the spec example:. . ./euchre.exe pack.in noshuffle 1 Adi Simple Barbara Simple Chi-Chih Simple Dabbala Simple . but, the output returns immediately in my terminal and won't let me run through the debugger. "args": ["pack.in", "noshuffle", "1", "Adi", "Simple", "Barbara", "Simple", "Chi-Chih", "Simple", "Dabbala", "Simple"],. . . this basically tells the debugger what to input as arguments when it runs the selected file. subject: which card to discard
content: if I have these cards:. . c->add_card(ace_hearts);. c->add_card(king_hearts);. c->add_card(queen_hearts);. c->add_card(ten_hearts);. c->add_card(jack_hearts);. . then the upcard is jack_diamonds, would I discard the 10H becasue the Jack of diamonds is the LB, or does that not count in this section, if this happened then I would play jack of diamonds becasue I only have trumps or does that count as trump in this context?
i_answer: Your discarding is correct if the trump is Hearts. But, the proposed trump will be diamonds at first. So in round 1, simple player wouldn’t accept it since they only have 1 trump card (Jack of hearts). In round 2, however, the proposed trump switches to hearts and you would discard 10 hearts since Jack of Diamonds is the left bower. Also, you would play the highest trump card if all your cards are trump. Assuming Hearts is trump, you would play in this order Jack of hearts, Jack of diamonds, ace, king, queen of hearts.

subject: Simple Player's decision making strategy confusion (euchre.cpp)
content: . Hello, in this scenario, the trump is diamonds, and Fran has a 9 of diamonds, and a 10 of spades. Yet, in the second last round, Fran decides to discard a 9 of diamonds (trump suit, so its larger than 10 of spades) instead of a 10 of spades? What is the thought process here? This is Hand 1 in the euchre_test01 file. . Thanks!.
i_answer: Since the trump suit is diamonds, that means the jack of hearts is also the trump suit (left bower), so the led suit for that first trick is diamonds. Fran follows suit by playing the nine of diamonds, which is why Fran discards it instead of the ten of spades.

subject: Player to the left
content: Hello,. . I am a bit confused about which one is the eldest hand. In the simple player example, if player0 is Adi (dealer) and player1 is Barbara. Will Barbara be Adi's left player and eldest hand? Thank you!
i_answer: The player to the left of the dealer is the eldest hand. Since the game is played clockwise (i.e. the current player's left plays next), we define an increment in index (0 --> 1) to represent that order. In your example, yes, Barbara is the eldest hand if Adi deals.

subject: Issue with hand 10 in euchre_test01
content: Hi, . I was comparing my output for euchre_test01 to the given output, and encountered an issue. . The teams for this test are as follows:. Team 1: Edsger and Gabriel. Team 2: Fran and Herb. . For hand 10, Edsger orders up spades. Therefore, the other team, Fran and Herb, are the defenders. . In the final hand, as discussed in the euchre_test01 explanation here, Herb takes the first three tricks and Fran takes the last two. . This should mean that team 2, the defenders, win the hand by a score of 5-0. This qualifies as both a march and a euchre, since they are the defenders. However, the explanation linked above states that the score was 3-2, and the output given in the file only prints "euchred!" and not "march!" before that, which is how I found the issue. Everything else in our program seems to be running clearly, so I would appreciate some clarification on this issue. . . If there is both a march and a euchre, are we only supposed to print "euchred!", or are we supposed to print both. Is this an error in the explanation? Thank you!. (I have attached images of the "correct" output and our output. As you can see, they are the same except that one line.). Screenshot_2023-02-18_at_10.50.27_PM.png. Screenshot_2023-02-18_at_10.50.35_PM.png. .
i_answer: From the spec:. . March: When the side that made trump* wins all 5 tricks.. Euchred: When the side that didn’t make trump* wins 3, 4, or 5 *tricks.. . . Since they didn't make trump, they cannot march, they can only euchre.

subject: ranking
content: is ten of diamonds less than a jack of clubs. Or, does suit order come before rank order in the hierarchy.
i_answer: “ In the simplest case, cards are ordered by rank (A > K > Q > J > 10 > 9), with ties broken by suit (D > C > H > S).” — spec

subject: What does the left arrow sign mean when comparing the difference using sdiff
content: Hello,. . Could you please tell me what does the arrow (please see the red circle in attachment) mean? I checked my code and don't think it prints an extra line below "Adi and Chichin have1 points" and "Barbara and ...". . Thank you!.
i_answer: < denotes that the line is only in the first file ("Adi and Chi-Chih have 2 points" is only in the left file).. . | means that the lines are different ("euchred!" is different from "Adi and Chi-Chih have 1 points" are different).. . Together, these just mean that in the first file the following:. . euchred!Adi and Chi-Chih have 2 points. . was replaced with. . Adi and Chi-Chih have 1 points.

If you really really wanted to, then you could do something like this, with dynamic casts.

subject: Euchrecpp Debugging Question Resolved
content: HNever mind resolved thanks. . Hi, when Fran has this hand below, why does he discard the upcard (9 of hearts I believe) instead of the 9 of spades? Thanks.
i_answer: For anyone else wondering, Fran does not discard the nine of hearts, because he is never given the option. Fran orders up hearts, but Edsger is the dealer, and add_and_discard is called on him. Edsger does not discard the nine of hearts either.

subject: Initializing players vector
content: How do I initialize the players vector in euchre.cpp? (setting each player to their name and player type)
i_answer: The players vector (proposed by the spec) has Player pointers. Take a look at the Polymorphism lecture slides on how to get base class pointers that refer to instances of a derived class.

subject: "Implicitly declared private here" error on HumanPlayer and SimplePlayer
content: My partner and I are getting the error: "Player.cpp:8:22: note: implicitly declared private here" (pointing to the lines where we create the derived classes HumanPlayer and SimplePlayer) when trying to run public player test. Our constructors in both derived classes are public. We think this is a source for others errors we are getting when we try to create human and simple player objects. Is it supposed to be private and our other errors are from something else? If not, how can we get the derived classes to be public?
i_answer: Make sure you're declaring the derived classes as deriving from a public Player. For example,. . class SimplePlayer : public Player {. 	// .... };

subject: Euchre scoring clarification - winner of each hand
content: In describing which team wins a certain hand, the project specs say that:. . "The team that takes the majority of tricks receives points for that hand. If the winning team had also ordered up, they get 1 point for taking 3 or 4 tricks, and 2 points for taking all 5.". . Does this mean that they get 1 point for 3 or 4 tricks, OR 2 points for all 5?

subject: Shuffling and resetting
content: Can someone explain to me how shuffling and resetting works? Do we reset the pack at the end of each round regardless of the shuffle setting, and then if the user chooses to shuffle then we also shuffle the pack at the beginning of each round? So if the setting was noshuffle we'd just reset the pack at the end of each round? And if it was shuffle we'd shuffle at the start of each round and reset the pack at the end of each round?
i_answer: Just to add on to the students' answer, if the setting is noshuffle, then you would reset the pack at the start of each hand as well.

subject: Property stdio is not allowed when setting input redirection
content: How to solve this? Anyone with same issue?. . . "name": "(lldb) Launch",. "type": "cppdbg",  (*I set it up as lldb but it shows this way). "request": "launch",. "program": "${workspaceFolder}/euchre.exe",. "stdio": ["euchre_test50.in", null, null],. "args": ["pack.in", "noshuffle", "1", "Adi", "Simple", "Barbara", "Simple", "Chi-Chih", "Simple", "Dabbala" ,"Simple"],. "stopAtEntry": false,. "cwd": "${workspaceFolder}",. "environment": [],. "externalConsole": false,. "MIMode": "lldb". . also, the type shows as cppdbg in setup tutorial as well so I'm confused..
i_answer: 1. Delete your `launch.json`. 2. Follow the new platform-specific [macOS create `launch.json`](https://eecs280staff.github.io/tutorials/setup_vscode.html#macos-create-launchjson). 3. Try again to configure [macOS input redirection](https://eecs280staff.github.io/tutorials/setup_vscode.html#macos-launchjson-changes). . The root cause of this problem is a `launch.json` that's configured to use the Microsoft C/C++ extension instead of the CodeLLDB extension.  It was an easy mistake to make because in retrospect, the instructions could have been better (my fault -- awdeorio).  I fixed the instructions so now there are separate sections for macOS and Windows `launch.json` setup.. . Sorry for the confusion!  Please let me know if I missed anything in the fresh tutorial update.. . ----. stdio i don't believe is a valid launch.json field. If you want to do input and output redirection do . . ```. .... "args": ["pack.in", "noshuffle", "1", "Adi", "Simple", "Barbara", "Simple", "Chi-Chih", "Simple", "Dabbala" ,"Simple", "", "euchre_test50.out"],. .... ```

subject: add_and_discard human
content: Hi! I am trying to implement the add_and_discard function for the human player.  I was not sure what this meant in the specs: cout << "Discard upcard: [-1]\n"; . . Why would we want to discard the upcard? Because, I thought that we would want to keep the upcard for the human dealer and just discard our lowest one.
i_answer: My understanding is it's not saying you should always discard the upcard, it's saying when the upcard you picked is the lowest card in your hand, then u should discard it. that's why it says"(or -1 if they want to discard the upcard)".

subject: card_less suit cards comparison
content: If I have Jack of Diamonds and Jack of Hearts but none of them are led or trump suit, do I get true if jack of hearts is less than jack of diamonds or do i not have to compare these two?
i_answer: If the cards are neither the led or trump suit, you would compare the cards as normal: ranks (A > K > Q > J > 10 > 9), with ties broken by suit (D > C > H > S). So, you should get true if the jack of hearts is less than the jack of diamonds.

subject: noshuffle vs shuffle

subject: Dealing Cards
content: I'm confused on dealing cards in the driver program. If we should get to the end of the pack, do we just reset it and start from the beginning again? Do we reset the pack at the beginning of each hand when we shuffle it, or is it ok if a hand begins with the "next" variable on, say, 13?
i_answer: We need to reset it. In other words, for each hand there will be 3 (excluding the upcards) unused cards.

subject: card_less second function
content: I don't really understand how to approach the second card_less function. What cases should I consider? and how should I structure it?. .
i_answer: Well, here's the order that the cards are in from highest to lowest:. Right bower (jack of trump). Left bower (jack of other color of trump). Ace of trump. .... Nine of trump. Ace of led. .... Nine of led. The rest of the cards are just compared normally (you can use <, >, etc. for them). . If the trump suit is equal to the led suit, its the same thing, just remove the "Ace of led ... Nine of led". . So start by checking if the cards are right/left bowers, in trump/led suit, etc. . . Hope that helps!

subject: card_less error
content: Card.cpp:238:14: error: member reference base type 'Suit' is not a structure or union    if(suit_a.is_right_bower(suit_a)) {. . I'm getting this error in card_less function. I tried to use the previous written member function from card but it is saying that the type 'Suit' is not a structure or union. I'm not sure how to fix this problem. Or is there another way to write the program?. . Thank you so much
i_answer: I believe you are calling the function slightly wrong. If suit_a is a suit, then you should pass it into the function since is right bower takes in a suit which it treats as the trump suit. You are using suit_a as a card and a suit in this function call. If you are trying to determine if the card is right bower, make sure you have a Card c declared and a Suit trump declared. You would call it c.is_right_bower(trump) I believe in that case. Hope that helped!

subject: Card.cpp operator functions
content: do the operator functions in card.cpp just test two cards based on the basic order, like it is in pack.in? i'm trying to test these functions, so I just wanted to double check.
i_answer: Yes, the operator functions do not consider trump, so the order is how it is in pack.in. Cards are ordered by rank (A > K > Q > J > 10 > 9), with ties broken by suit (D > C > H > S).

subject: Helper function void shuffle in game class?
content: I thought we had already made most of the private helper functions suggested to be made in the other .cpp files. Is there a way to call these functions or do we have to remake, for example, shuffle from pack into the game class?
i_answer: Really, the structure of the Game class is entirely up to you. However, it can be really helpful to make smaller functions that perform smaller steps. Duplicating code isn't great, so you should definitely call the functions you've already implemented when you can. If you think that shuffling in the Game class isn't big enough to warrant its own function, then you don't have to.

subject: operator>>
content: Looking for some help with understanding the operator>> function in card.cpp.. currently have a public_tests error when running this, was looking to see if anyone had any suggestions on where to start fixing it. . . . std::istream & operator>>(std::istream &is, Card &card){. int x = card.get_rank();. int y = card.get_suit();. string str;. if (is >> str){. x = string_to_rank(str);. str += " of ";. y = string_to_suit(str);. . }. return is;. }.
i_answer: Set visibility to private since you've included an entire function. In the future, please don't make public posts with chunks of your own code.. . The purpose of operator>> is to be able to read in a Card. Currently, you're reading at most the rank into str and nothing more, but we really need to read the rank, the "of" in between, and the suit. Think more carefully about what you're actually trying to do.. . You should be reading in something in the format of "<rank> of <suit>," and this should modify the rank and suit of card. We've also provided functions operator>>(std::istream &is, Rank &rank) and operator>>(std::istream &is, Suit &suit), and you should be able to use these to help you read in the values and set the members of card.. . Example usage of the provided operator>> functions:. . Rank rank;. Suit suit;. is >> suit >> rank; // Let's say is has "Spades Nine". cout << rank << " of " << suit << endl; // Prints "Nine of Spades"

i_answer: @1699 -- the probable cause is that you are calling `sort` on a member variable inside of a const function. Since `sort` modifies what is being sorted, this violates const and leads to the above error.

subject: Question about output in euchre and player
content: Currently not getting credit for the euchre with solution player, pack, card, but getting credit for my euchre implementation. Looking at the faq, I believe the issue is that I'm printing output in player that should be printed in euchre. My question is what should we print in player? I currently have hand details and play/led details being printed in player. What do I need to move (if anything) over to Euchre?
i_answer: You should only be printing player hands and prompts for taking in input (sample output is provided in the Human Player section of the spec for many of these) within Player.cpp. All game-related output such as leading / playing hands should be printed from the driver.
