subject: Player_test - how to test add and discard
content: I'm stuck at 16 / 17 for player_tests, and I really want to know how to solve it. I guess it's still because of not enough test cases for add and discard, but I don't know how to find more edge cases. I went to OH today and added no/some/all trump test cases as much as I could.. . I've submitted my code to auto grader. Please help me because I don't wanna be stuck on it for a weekend. Thank you in advance!!
i_answer: To test add and discard, I would run the add and discard function, then run play_card 5 times and assert that each card played matches what you expect to see. If your add and discard function is wrong, then one of the play_card calls will return the wrong card.

subject: Error when trying to check argv inputs (comparison with string literal error)
content: Hello, (in my euchre.cpp file) I am trying to check for errors in the argv inputs, specifically the shuffle argument and all the player type arguments, but I am getting an error saying: "error: comparison with string literal results in unspecified behavior." I'm doing if (argv[2] != "shuffle"), but all lines where I do this or something similar (comparing argv[i] and a string) are causing errors.. I'm not really sure how else I should check for errors in the argv inputs without doing string comparisons, so any thoughts are great appreciated! Thank you!
i_answer: argv is an array of strings, not c++ strings. You cannot directly use != or == to compare. Instead, you could convert to c++ strings and then compare, or use strcmp (from ) on the cstring you are comparing directly.

subject: Players vector
content: Can we use -> when working with the players vector in the Game ADT?
i_answer: If you use a vector of pointers then it would be fine to do `players[i]->`, yes. I would say a vector of pointers is the easiest way to work with the `Player_factory`.

subject: Error on AutoGrader
content: I am unsure what this error means and would love some assistance in figuring It out if possible I haven’t ever seen this error before
i_answer: It seems like you have a memory leak somewhere. Make sure you have a delete corresponding to every new. Also make sure you use delete[] when you use new to create an array.

subject: Simple Player Confusing Error's?
content: Can someone please look at my code for me because I'm not exactly sure what this means and before this it was working just fine with the other test cases(excluding the one with 2 and 3 in it).. .
i_answer: `control reaches end of non-void function` means that there are functions where you might not return a value. Here specifically it looks like you need to add return statements at the end of `lead_card` and `make_trump` so that you return something even if you don't go into any if statements.

subject: Input Redirection In Launch.json args
content: Hello!. . I am working on the last scenario, where the human players must follow the input from euchre_test50.in.. . The command works properly in the terminal, so it must be able to separately parse the "< euchre_test50.in", however when running the debugger config, with "< euchre_test50.in". as one of the args, it counts it as one of the C++ class args, Thus, argc = 13 instead of 12, causing the program to terminate.. . Does anyone have any suggestions of how to modify the launch.json test configuration for this scenario where "< euchre_test50.in" will not make my argc = 13?. . Thanks for the help!
i_answer: The VS Code setup tutorial has workarounds for input redirection here. In short, on Linux/WSL, make "<" and "euchre_test50.in" separate strings in the "args" array, rather than one combined string. If you're using the CodeLLDB extension on macOS, set the "stdio" variable instead.

subject: "Print an extra newline when making, adding, and discarding is complete."
content: I just want to confirm what this means? . . So this would occur once during each hand?. . And when they say "make," are we talking about make trump? I just want to clarify these steps. And these three procedures happen in the backend, not printed to the terminal right? We just show the result of that, but we know after we execute these functions, to print a new line right?
i_answer: Yes, you would print an extra newline when making trump, adding card (dealer), and discarding card (dealer) is completed in each round, respectively. You can run your driver on public tests without these newlines and use the sdiff command to compare against the correct output so that you can get a sense of where you should be putting your extra newlines.

subject: euchre.cpp (getting started)
content: Before I start my driver, I was wondering which lectures would be useful to review. Are lectures 11 and 12 going to be necessary?
i_answer: Although lectures 11 and 12 provide great practice and examples for how to create an ADT, you should have all the tools you need for Euchre after lecture 10.

subject: Line at top of euchre_test files causing diff to fail
content: Hi,. . I am running the tests on my code. However, whenever i run diff in my command line, the test fails. The only difference between my code and the correct answer is the little line at the top. . For example, the correct answer includes "./euchre.exe pack.in noshuffle 3 Ivan Human Judea Human Kunle Human Liskov Human" at the top. My output does not. All other parts of the output are the same as the correct output.. . Is there something I did wrong? How should I fix this?
i_answer: You are expected to print out the command to the ostream (i.e. the .out file you produce from euchre.cpp). Professor Juett said this was more of a design choice by the instructors, but all you need to implement is printing out all 12 arguments before printing anything else. Hint: there is a space followed by an endline after the last argument.. . The autograder also has the command on the first line of the .out.correct file which your output is being compared against.. . A Reference can be found here in the spec:. . https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#example-with-human-players:~:text=Simple%20Dabbala%20Simple-,First%2C%20print%20the%20executable%20and%20all%20arguments%20on%20the%20first%20line.%20Print%20a%20single%20space%20at%20the%20end%2C%20which%20makes%20it%20easier%20to%20print%20an%20array.,-./euchre.exe%20pack

subject: How do we keep track of an individual player's cards?
content: I understand that pack (all the 24 cards) are in an array, and there's a next variable to point to different parts of it. But for example, in euchre.cpp, how do we keep track what the four players' cards are? Do we create a new array, or are we still playing around with the indexing of the pack (array of cards) as a whole? I just want to clarify my approach with this.
i_answer: The main driver program, euchre.cpp, should not need to know what the four players' cards are. Instead, euchre.cpp should just be calling the member functions of players to orchestrate the game. Follow up with any additional questions!

subject: Testing add_card()
content: Hi, how do we test add_card() even if we don't need to? In my test function, I added two cards to a player's hand, but I realized I can't check the player's hand as it's a private member function. I tried making my own helper function called get_hand_card but I can't call it in player_tests.cpp. Any solution to this?
i_answer: Great question! As you mentioned, we cannot modify the Player interface to accommodate this. One approach could be to use repeated calls to a function like lead_card to access the cards in a player's hand and store it in some vector. Then you can inspect the vector's contents to see if the player had what you expected.

subject: add_and_discard function call
content: I tried to call the add_and_discard function inside of the make_trump function, but it resulted in an error. It says, "the object has type qualifiers that are not compatible with the member function "SimplePlayer::add_and_discard." Does anyone know what this means?
i_answer: I think this is due to the fact that make_trump() is a const function, meaning it cannot modify the Player object. However, add_and_discard() is not a const function, so the compiler cannot guarantee add_and_discard() won't modify the Player object when called from make_trump().. . Unfortunately, it looks like you cannot call add_and_discard() from make_trump(). Thinking ahead, can you call add_and_discard() from somewhere else when making trump?

subject: Error: Player Factory "no overrider" Error
content: I have implemented all the functions in both SimplePlayer and HumanPlayer, yet I have these errors that persist:. object of abstract class type "SimplePlayer" is not allowed:. pure virtual function "Player::make_trump" has no overrider. object of abstract class type "HumanPlayer" is not allowed:. pure virtual function "Player::make_trump" has no overrider. member function declared with 'override' does not override a base class member. member function declared with 'override' does not override a base class member. . Here is the function stub that is used for the two make_trump functions :. . bool make_trump(const Card &upcard, bool is_dealer,.                           int round, Suit &order_up_suit) override{.
i_answer: When overriding functions in derived classes, you have to be sure you match the function signature exactly. In this case, you are missing the const for the make_trump function.

subject: turn down upcard
content: is there a function that turns down the upcard once the first round of make trump is complete? or do we not have to even consider this
i_answer: I guess you don't need to worry about turning down the card. You simply do not consider the upcard suit in the second round. If making trump happens in the first round, the dealer will take the upcard and discard a card from his hand.

subject: human Player.cpp Question
content: Hi, in the human portion of player.cpp, should we be using cin here? or just in the euchre.cpp driver portion?. . Thanks
i_answer: Yes, you should be using cin

subject: Using new outside Player_factory
content: Is Player_factory the only way to test the Simple_player constructor because when I try to allocate memory for a new SimplePlayer in Player_tests.cpp the compiler says “Unknown type name ‘SimplePlayer’”This is what I wrote: const string &name = “fran”;Player *fran = new SimplePlayer(name);
i_answer: Calling your SimplePlayer or HumanPlayer constructors directly from Player_tests.cpp should not work, since neither of those classes are defined in Player.h (they should only be defined in Player.cpp); however, Player_factory() is defined in Player.h, so including Player.h is enough for you to be able to use it.. . You technically could get around this issue locally by adding class declarations for SimplePlayer and HumanPlayer to your Player.h, but you shouldn't do this: When you submit your cpp files to the autograder, we'll compile them against our own copies of the header files, so your Player_tests.cpp will just fail to compile.. . Thus, testing your constructors via Player_factory() is the only way, as far as I'm aware. However, your Player_factory() has the ability to test both constructors with every meaningful input, right? So you shouldn't have any trouble catching constructor-related bugs using just Player_factory().

subject: Pack.cpp card_up: confused on how we are supposed to call Card deal_one()?
content: little bit confused conceptually about how we are supposed to call the  Pack in pack.cpp?
i_answer: For deal_one(), it "Returns the next card in the pack and increments the next index". Think about when you may want to use "the next card". At the beginning of the game, we need to deal cards so each player has 5 cards in hand. deal_one() can help with tracking which is the next card to deal.

subject: bool is_dealer purpose
content: Hi!. . I was wondering what the purpose of the parameter bool is_dealer is. The spec says that the simple player does not consider whether they are a dealer. Also, I'm pretty sure for HumanPlayer I can't call add_and_discard within make_trump since it's a const function, so I am not sure what the purpose of is_dealer is. Am I missing something? . . Let me know! . .
i_answer: . The spec says that the simple player does not consider whether they are a dealer.. . For making trump, think about how knowing whether you are the dealer or not matters. Per spec, "If making reaches the dealer during the second round, a variant called screw the dealer is invoked: the dealer must order up a suit other than the rejected suit."

subject: negative space
content: negative space error after i use hand.erase one i
i_answer: You are deleting from an empty hand most likely

subject: assert
content: Can we use assert statements in place of if and if else statements? Would this cause the test to fail is the assert is false? I'm not sure if assert returns a boolean value or causes the tests to abort.
i_answer: . Can we use assert statements in place of if and if else statements? Would this cause the test to fail is the assert is false? I'm not sure if assert returns a boolean value or causes the tests to abort.. . if statements create a logical flow to your program. Meaning if x, do y, else do z. Assert statement are a way of enforcing presumptions or requirements of a function or program (like the statements in your REQUIRES clause.. . Asserts are what we call a macro (macro = not a function, a placeholder that gets substituted with another piece of code). Whatever you have inside of an assert should be a boolean value (e.g. 1 > 2). Assert will abort the program if the boolean value inside of it is false.. . . assert(1 > 2); // will abort

subject: HumanPlayer add_and_discard
content: Hi! . . I was wondering if, for the HumanPlayer implementation of add_and_discard, we should add the upcard to the dealer's hand before or after printing the player's hand. . . Let me know! . thanks!
i_answer: The upcard should be added after printing the players hand, as it wont actually be shown as part of the hand. .

subject: Make trump: screw the dealer
content: If the dealer does not have the suit of the upcard or the next suit, what does the dealer choose as trump? The suit that they have the most of?
i_answer: No matter what is in the simple players hand, they will order up the suit that is the same color as the up card.

subject: Question regarding play card
content: I should play the Jack of Diamonds here correct because it is the left bower and therefore the highesttrump card?
i_answer: No, since the player is able to follow suit, they must follow suit. Thus the ace of diamonds should be played. The Jack of diamonds in this case is considered a heart because hearts is trump.

subject: Euchre Design
content: I was thinking through my design for euchre.cpp, In the example in the spec, the vector of players is a private member function, but you would want to add the players in the vector through the command line arguments in main which would not work so I am a bit confused. Is it ok to make that variable public or is there another way. Thank you.
i_answer: It is good practice to make member variables of a class private. You could read in the players in your main function and pass them into the class object through various ways, constructor, public setter functions, etc.

subject: Pointer in public player test.
content: So in this image, we have a pointer variable equal to Player_factory, originally a pointer. Is the value of Player_factory just 2 strings or is it an address?. . My other question is when we do ASSERT_EQUAL(oss2.str(), "Alice"); , why does it true but when I do. ASSERT_EQUAL(oss2.str(), "Simple"); it returns false?. . ![image.png](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=paste%2Fkt04r5j3l2i2t6%2Fcabcc34d0b87ffb1540973c2c184d6efb491c87bcffbbc360bf04a066667dbc2%2Fimage.png)
i_answer: Player_factory is a function that returns a pointer that points to a player(simple/human depending on the function input) instance.. . oss2.str() is Alice because we've overloaded the << operator to print the name of a player, and the name of the player that alice points to is Alice.

subject: Not properly reading in from euchre_test50.in
content: When calling my humanplayer::make_trump function in my euchre driver, I am reading in an empty string from euchre_test50.in. It works for hand 0 but as hand 1 starts and the first player is supposed to pass, the string that holds the input from the file is empty, causing an error. What might be causing this bug?. . Edit:. The student answer actually helped me understand what the issue was. I realized that I had been calling add_and_discard on the current player, rather than on the dealer, and I didn't check to see whether it was round 1 or 2. It now works properly.
i_answer: We are not aware of any issues with euchre_test50.in. If you look at the output of euchre_test50.correct, the game ends at three hands. So there is no need to write more input.

subject: Simple player play_card Trump card versus normal card
content: For the play card function, if a player has no cards of the led suit, two cards of the trump suit, and two regular cards, will they play their highest (one of the trump suit cards) or lowest card? I am confused on what happens in the player has trump suit cards and regular cards. Thank you!
i_answer: If the player has no card of the led suit, they will play the lowest card on hand. Since in this scenario, both the trump and led suit has been determined, the lowest card is selected with the trump and led suit in mind. So in your example, the player will play the lowest one of the regular cards.

subject: Way to change the value of cards, depending on situation? (Ex: has trump card, led card, etc.)
content: I understand that if there's a trump card present, or there's a led card, then the value of the cards is slightly different (ex: right bower, left bower, and the led card suits).. . How can I take this into account when comparing the ranks of the cards, if the enum values of the rank is set? Is there a way to change the integer values of the rank? Or is this the right approach?
i_answer: When using the operators >,<, ..., you only need to compare based on rank and suit, ignoring trump, led card, etc.. . For both of the card_less functions, you'll need to consider a lot of test cases - for example, returning true if b is the right bower and a is not the right bower. You should not be changing ranks of cards here.

subject: Make_trump for Human Player
content: So I am having a very hard time trying to understand what to do when writing this function and most likely the other ones as well because this is what I have currently and someone posted earlier that is_dealer shouldn't be in the first round but can't the dealer be the player? Also I am completely stumped on how to utilize the other parameters to finish this function and again most likely the others.  Also the human players aren't allowed to cheat on choosing a different option besides the suit on lead right?. print_hand();        if (round == 1) {            cout << "Human player " << name_ << ", please enter a suit, or \"pass\":\n";            string decision;            cin >> decision;.             if (decision != "pass") {                Suit ordered_up = string_to_suit(decision);                return false;            }            else {                if (is_dealer == true) {                    order_up_suit = upcard.get_suit();                    return true;                }.             }        }        if (round == 2) {            cout << "Human player " << name_ << ", please enter a suit, or \"pass\":\n";            string decision;            cin >> decision;.             if (decision != "pass") {                Suit ordered_up = string_to_suit(decision);                return false;            }            else {                Card bestcard;                cin >> bestcard;            }        }
i_answer: 1. Questions about is_dealer: you can assume dealer will order up when it is their turn. You don't need to check it. You just need to read the input and set order_up_suit according to the input.. . 2. Don't know how to use all parameters: you don't need to use all parameters in human's make_trump function. . 3. Human can't cheat, you can always assume human will always follow the rule

subject: Euchre.cpp Discarded Cards
content: For euchre.cpp, what do we do with the discards? For example, where does the discarded card from the dealer in make trump go? is it to a "discard" pile (vector) with the other three unused cards? And when we play out a trick, where and in what order do those cards go into? . . My guess is that at the end of the round, the "discard pile" would then be set to the deck, which would be shuffled and then used in the next round, but the euchre_test_out files lead me to believe that there's a specific order that should be followed in order to achieve the desired result. In manual playing of the game, this order doesn't really matter since we're human and the cards are essentially shuffled at the beginning of each game and shuffled in between, but it seems to me that order matters in the test cases and auto-grader.... . I'd be happy to further elaborate on any confusions. Thanks in advance,
i_answer: You don't need to do anything with discarded cards, since they are not used after add_and_discard is added. The student answer is a valid way to approach the problem.

subject: simple player (play tricks part,)
content: ". If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit. Otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand.. ". . If my leading suit is (SPADE), and my Trump suit is also SPADES. In that case, is the highest follow card (JACK, SPADES) or (ACE, SPADES)?. . Secondly, when we play the lowest card in my hand, I have the following questions. for instance, the leading suit is (Hearts), and the Trump suit is (SPADES). If my hand has (NINE, SPADES) and (TEN, HEARTS) which ranks are the 1st lowest and 2nd lowest, should I play the (TEN, HEARTS), because it is lowest and not trump?
i_answer: To address the first situation: Which of those cards is of higher value in this particular moment? (Think of the cards as a hierarchy of values due to trump instead of just their numbers). . To address the second: In the rules of Euchre, if you have a card of the lead suit, you must play a card of the lead suit. Even if another card in your hand is higher due to trump, simple and human players are bound to the rules to follow suit.. . I hope that helps!

subject: add_and_discard Testing
content: How are we supposed to test add_and_discard for Simple Players? Since we don't have a function that gets cards from the hand, the only way that I see to test if the correct card was discarded is to repeatedly call lead_card and compare to a player that has the desired hand. However, this doesn't allow us to test add_and_discard without lead_card. . . Is there a better way? I've thought of a couple of solutions, but they would involve adding helper functions and so couldn't be used for the mutation testing.
i_answer: It's completely okay to have tests that use multiple functions inside of them. I would agree that it's difficult to test add_and_discard() without using lead_card(). Instead of trying to test each function in isolation, I would think of testing different scenarios that push edge cases for all of the functions involved. I hope that helps!

subject: quest about pointer and derived class
content: what is the result of that slide in the lecture？it just return 1，12 or three sides of Triangle？
i_answer: This is a really good question, and really important idea (polymorphism, static vs dynamic type).. The short answer: at this point in the slides, it will execute Triangle::print(), so it will print the three sides of Triangle.. . However, there is a later slide that talks about this:. . . . . Since ptr points to an Isosceles, it seems natural that Isosceles::print should be called rather than Triangle::print.. We can accomplish this by making Triangle::print a virtual function:. . . . If Triangle is defined like this, the ptr->print from your original question will use Isosceles::print, thus printing 1, 12

subject: Formatting in euchre_test50 inconsistent
content: I'm probably missing something, but I was wondering why the euchre_test50.out.correct does not contain an empty line between line 186 and 187? Normally, when a player orders up a suit, the console prints "[Player] orders up [Suit]" followed by a new line (see line 39-40 in euchre_test50.out.correct, line 5-6 in euchre_test01.out.correct, etc.). However, in this instance, the correct output file indicates that their should not be an empty line after the order-up statement is called. Anybody know why?. . Thanks in advance!
i_answer: The newline comes after the ordering up process is finished. In this case, since Judea is a human player, she needs to discard a card. The new line comes after that happens.. .

subject: play_card function in autograder euchre_test_01
content: Hi, I'm confused about the play_card function. For a Simple player, I thought players are meant to play the highest card of the led suit if possible. But in the autograder euchre_test_01, on line 21 Gabriel plays Nine of Clubs, even though the lead suit is Diamonds and he has a Jack of Diamonds as shown in line 32..
i_answer: This is normally the case, but you have to keep in mind that since the trump suit in this round is Hearts, the Jack of Diamonds (which is the left bower), is considered a heart (and not a diamond). Therefore, the only cards remaining are considered trump (besides the nine of clubs), so Gabriel plays the nine of clubs. Hopefully this makes sense!

subject: Making trump second round
content: I saw in the spec that if the player is a dealer than they must order up the same color as the led suit. What if there is no same color of the led suit in the dealer's cards? Is this led suit the suit that was rejected in the first round or is this a new suit in this second round?
i_answer: The dealer's cards don't have any effect on what suit can actually be chosen for trump. For the first round, you can ONLY chose the same suit as the upcard, or to pass. Anyone can choose any suit to be trump in the second round, regardless of the cards in their hand.The SimplePlayer that you'll be implementing, however, follows set rules (self-imposed rules, if you will) when picking a suit in the second round. SimplePlayers will only ever order up the suit of the same color as the upcard (for example, if the upcard was Diamonds, the SimplePlayer would only consider Hearts by this rule). Again, in a real game, any suit can be picked in the second round, but the bots follow this limitation to make the implementation easier.

subject: should we use pointer in the vector declaration for Cards in player's hand?
content: When we create the vector of Cards in player's hand, should we use a pointer in the vector declaration?. . I'm still confused with the reason for using pointers in vector, which one should we use for the vector declaration?. .     vector<Card> hand (MAX_HAND_SIZE);. or.     vector<Card*> hand (MAX_HAND_SIZE);
i_answer: You could use a vector of pointers if you really wanted to. However, I would strongly advise against it since there are only at most 24 cards you have to deal with, and the headache of managing memory isn’t worth it for that little performance gain, if any.

subject: Playing Tricks SimplePlayer Complex Strategy
content: So I was looking at the play_card.cpp and I was starting to implement the simple strategy and realized that there is also a complex strategy. "A more complex strategy would also consider the cards on the table.". . Do you expect us to have the complex strategy done as well or is it up to us whether we choose the bots to be more simple or not?. . Also should we not check to see if there is a trump in their hand then play it if they have it or is that too much because the project specs don't say that when playing a card.

subject: SimplePlayer Strategy
content: If a player has Queen Diamonds, Ten Diamonds, Queen Clubs, Ace Clubs, and Jack of Hearts. The trump suit is Diamonds and the Jack of Spades was led. What would be played?
i_answer: First, the simple player would consider the suit that was led: spades. Since they do not have any spades, they cannot play within the suit.. . Also, note that Jack of Hearts is actually a diamonds because it is the left bower.. . So, the player would play the lowest card in their hand, which is Queen of Clubs.. . In case you were curious, the ranking of the cards in their hand, from highest to lowest, is:. - Jack of Hearts. - Queen of Diamonds. - Ten of Diamonds. - Ace of Clubs. - Queen of Clubs

subject: Player Factory
content: This functions returns a pointer to player. Is creating a object of the derived class using new keyword considered a pointer to that object? I'm also wondering if we could call Player factory for the operator << function that prints the player's name.
i_answer: The new keyword creates an object of the specified class and returned a pointer to that object, which lives on the heap and not in the stack. Returning a pointer to an object of derived class is OK because it is an Upcast, as explained in last week's lecture (Since HumanPlayer / SimplePlayer defined and overwrote all functions declared in Player, there is no problem calling a virtual Human member function since it will at runtime redirect to the version of that function overwritten in the derived classes). . . For operator

subject: make_trump function for simple player
content: hello, I was wondering for simple players in round 2, when they don't have any face cards of the suit of the same color, and if they are the dealer, would we check if they have any other cards of of the suit of the next color before we return true for make_trump and setting the order_up_suit as suit of the next color? Or would we just return true regardless if they have any cards of the suit of the same color? Would appreciate any help.. .
i_answer: It doesn't matter whether you check if SimplePlayer has any card of the next suit or not. As a simple player, if the player must order up, it will order up the next suit in round 2. As the dealer in round 2, the player is forced to order up regardless of his cards. Therefore, a SimplePlayer dealer will always order up the next suit in round 2 regardless of whether it has any cards of that suit.

subject: player.cpp function implementation
content: When we implement the player functions in the two player subclasses in player.cpp, is it necessary to include the "virtual" before each function. Also, do we need the Player:: before the functions also?
i_answer: You only need scope operator if you implement outside of the class definition, so if you implement inside the class don't use the scope operator:. . ```. class SimplePlayer : public Player {. .... const std::string& get_name() {. }. .... } // end of class definition. ```. . If you implement outside the class like this, use the scope operator but using `SimplePlayer::` like so. ```. class SimplePlayer : public Player {. .... }; // end of class definition. . const std::string& SimplePlayer::get_name() {. }. ```

subject: Euchre Rules: Confused about what "ordering up" actually does
content: If a player orders up a suit, does that mean that the card is actually played (as in removed from hand)? . For example, if a player orders up spades, would that mean the spades card should be erased from the hand vector? . (I'm confused since the make_trump function only returns a bool (rather than an actual card)). . Thanks!
i_answer: The make_trump function returns a bool to tell you if the person ordered up a suit or not (true means the person did order up). When the player orders up the upcard, the dealer should pickup the up-card, which temporarily gives them 6 cards in their hand. Then, according to the human or simple player's decision, the dealer will discard a card. Then, the trick taking phase of the game can begin.

subject: Play_card test case false positive
content: In our test case, the simple player has a hand of 9 hearts, 10 diamonds, Jack hearts, King diamonds, and Ace diamonds. 9 of diamonds is the led card and hearts is the trump suit.. . So, theoretically, Jack of hearts should be the card played since it's the left bower of the led suit right? But, autograder says that this test specifically results in a false positive, so am I understanding something wrong?
i_answer: The bower rules only apply to the trump suit, not the suit led. In this case, the Player should play the ace of diamonds, as it is the highest card of the led suit. The bowers are both considered to be the suit of the trump (so if the Player had a Jack of Diamonds, it couldn't be played here as it's considered to be a heart card due to the bower/trump rules).

subject: SimplePlayer playcard
content: Say the led card was a left bower of the trump suit, would the simple player want to then play a card of the literal suit that the Jack led card is, or the trump suit?
i_answer: The left bower is no longer its original suit: it is the trump suit. So the suit on its face doesn’t matter. SimplePlayer would want to play the trump suit.

subject: Simple Play Card Strategy
content: For simple player, if the trump is spades, the leading card is Jack of club.  The simple player has Queen of Diamond,  Nine of Clubs, and Ten of Clubs.  What should the simple player do..  Since Jack of club is a left bower, does the simple player play the highest value (Queen of Diamond), or follow suits (ten of clubs) or the lowest value nine of clubs.
i_answer: Since the Jack of Clubs is the left bower, it is considered as a trump card, which has Suit Spades. In this case, since the simple player does not have any Spades card, it follows with the lowest card on hand, which is the Nine of Clubs.

subject: About add_and_discard function
content: I keep getting this error. What should I do to fix this function?? .
i_answer: Right now, order_up has no value, yet you use it in a comparison with upcard.get_suit(). This will lead to undefined behavior as your computer has no idea what it is comparing upcard.get_suit() with. To fix this, simply assign order_up a value to start with.

subject: When does is_dealer come into play in make_trump()

i_answer: Yes, is_dealer is only used in round 2.

subject: this->
content: Is it necessary to use this-> in card.cpp and pack.cpp? For example, in the get_rank function, I returned rank but I'm not sure if I was supposed to return this->rank. I thought "this" was only when dealing with pointers, but I'm just checking.
i_answer: "this->" is used to access member variables of a class within a member function. It is optional so no you don't necessarily need it. It is useful to clarify which variable you are specifying when there is another local variable with the same name (just don't do that). . . the "->" operator is used when dealing with pointers, as opposed to "." when working directly with objects.

subject: Scenario
content: If a simple player had the Nine of Diamonds, Ten of Diamonds, Queen of Clubs, Ace of Clubs, and the Jack of Hearts. The trump suit is Diamonds and the led card is the Jack of Diamonds. He would play the highest card that follows suit. Would the left bower, Jack of Hearts count for same suit or would the ten of diamonds be played in this instance. Thank you.
i_answer: The Jack of Hearts should be played. This is because the left bower is considered to be part of the trump suit, so assuming Diamonds was led, this would be the highest card that follows suit.

subject: shuffle() function
content: i'm having some trouble with the shuffle function. i made two arrays that store 12 cards each, but i'm not sure how to proceed from that. i'm not able to understand how i'm supposed to implement the function on wikipedia. i'd appreciate any hints on how i should think of this problem.. . also, when it says that we need to perform the shuffling 7 times, does that mean that we need to use a for loop to go over our entire function 7 times? . . thank you!

i_answer: Does it compile? Sometimes VSCode gets confused but compiling in the command line is always the ground truth.. . Edit: the operator>> is outside the scope of the Card class because it is not a member function. This means that you cannot directly access any private elements of the Card class, which rank and suit are. This is why we have getRank() and getSuit() functions so that we can access those private member variables outside of the class.

subject: Simple Player Strategy
content: Quick question about the simple player strategy… so if the simple player has no cards of the led suit in their hand, they will play the lowest possible card even if that card is the trump suit? - for instance, if hearts is led and spades is trump & the simple player has no hearts but has a nine of spades and a nine of diamonds in their hand, the simple player should play the nine of spades because it is the lowest possible card — Even though the 9 of spades is of the trump suit it is not taken into consideration?
i_answer: No, the 9 of diamonds will be played since the spades is the trump suit. This means that in the context of this hand, any card that is a spade will be automatically higher than cards with any other suits. Therefore, in this hand, the nine of spades will be higher than the nine of diamonds. Since the player has a lower card in their hand, the nine of diamonds, the simple player will play this card when given the choice between them.

subject: About play_card function
content: I'm getting this error but I don't know how to fix it. Can you give me any suggestion?. .
i_answer: That error is printed when it's possible for the function to never hit a return statement. In this case, you have returns in an if/else if, but if neither of those branches ever execute, then you exit the for loop without having returned.

subject: Player.cpp - making_trump - enforcing screw the dealer (humanplayer)
content: For the Human Player, how should we enforce the screw the dealer rule; that is, not letting them pass if they are the dealer and it is round 2 of making trump? Is there a specific message we should output if they try to pass? Or is this covered under the assumption that the player won't try to cheat?
i_answer: You can assume that the human player won’t cheat, so there is no special message you need to print to enforce the screw the dealer rule.

subject: Shuffling for each tricks
content: For each tricks, do we reshuffle our packs? What I mean is before we start the game, we will shuffle (or non-shuffle) our pack. After we finish the first trick, do we need to perform a shuffle again on top of the previous shuffle, or we will just use the same shuffled deck? I believe that we should only call the shuffle function once, but if this is the case, wouldn't all subsequent tricks occur exactly as the first trick if we have 4 simple player?
i_answer: No, you don’t have to shuffle for each trick. The hands will be different each time for each trick because after you play a trick, you discard the hand from the simple players hand. Thus every trick will be played with a different 4 cards.

subject: pack constructor
content: . . what does this code from the spec do? i know it says you can loop through the underlying integer representation, but i think the static_cast<Suit>(s) is throwing me off. is that supposed to be an array or something else? overall, i'm just very confused on what these 3 lines of code are supposed to do and how they're supposed to help with the constructor.
i_answer: The static cast is turning the integer into a suit. For example in the definition of the suit enum, SPADES is defined to be 0. If you static cast 0 into a suit, it then turns the 0 into SPADES.

subject: File in
content: Since we're reading from a file, would we want to edit the args in launch.json? My code stops at a line and wouldn't go into debug mode. I tried stepping in but nothing happens after making pack public test. I can see what tests fail but even if I set a breakpoint and make clean and run the test again, it wouldn't step out of the line. i_answer: If you are running euchre.cpp which mandates arguments, then yes you would need to fill in the args in launch.json with the correct arguments. subject: Deal_one is returning two of spades instead of nine of spades
content: when I step through and debug deal_one, cards at the index of next is set equal to the two of spades and I'm confused why since when pack is declared in the first unit test, it populates pack.cards correctly.  I thought it would access the first element of cards which should be the nine of spades? Thanks!
i_answer: When you say populates pack.cards correctly what exactly do you mean? Is it creating a full deck with 52 cards or only 9-A. Without seeing your code, my guess is you need to rethink your logic on incrementing next. You want to return the card at index next and then increment it. Remember that doing ++next will increment next then do ALL operations on the line. Doing next++ will do ALL operations on the line and then increment next. . . In regards to the follow up, deal_one only deals the card at the 'top' of the deck (aka index 0), then marks that card as dealt by incrementing next. That means next acts as a reference to the top card index, which is why we have to increment it after returning the top card. When a deck is shuffled, we have no idea what cards are where and we can't go based off rank or suit.

subject: Sort deck issue
content: Hi I'm trying to use the sort function to sort my hand before printing, but whenever I do I get all of these errors. How can I fix this?. .
i_answer: I ran into this issue myself, and had to do a bit of Googling to figure out what the issue was.. . So, it turns out that the "const" modifier after the member function declaration (the "const" in "void print_hand() const", for example) essentially tells the compiler that the member function DOES NOT modify any of the member variables of the class being dealt with.. . Note that "make_trump" does not modify any member variables of any of the Player classes, and so is defined as being "const." Functions declared as "const" can ONLY run other "const" functions, as otherwise they could potentially change member variables of the class (which is not allowed by the compiler). This means that "print_hand" must also be declared as "const".. . The issue here is with the sort function—the sort function DIRECTLY CHANGES one of the member variables of the Player class (the Player's hand, namely), which is illegal. This is where the "swap" errors come in, since the swap function is TRYING to alter the "hand" variable of the Player class, but due to the "const" definition, this is illegal.. . To fix the issue, we CANNOT alter any of the member variables of the Player class in any way. The easiest way to solve this problem, therefore, is to simply create a COPY of the Player's hand, and then sort and print the COPY. This way, we aren't actually altering any member variables of the class.. . This is the way I understood it, feel free to correct me if I'm mistaken.. . Here's a good StackOverflow answer that pointed me in the right direction:. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13103755/intellisense-the-object-has-type-qualifiers-that-are-not-compatible-with-the-me

subject: add_and_discard(const Card &upcard) - how to remove an element from a vector?
content: We have tried to use .clear() and .erase() but both of them don't work in our code. It shows an error that "no instance of overloaded function "std::__1::vector<_Tp, _Allocator>::erase [with _Tp=Card, _Allocator=std::__1::allocator<Card>]" matches the argument list.". . I saw a post asked about this and the instructor refers to a question in the Project 3 Q&A post but for some reason, I cannot find any questions about "How to use erase function?" in that post.
i_answer: The standard vector function `.erase() `requires you to use iterators (a type of object that can traverse a container, in this case a vector) in order to use it. Iterators will be covered later in the course, but here's what you need to know for using `.erase()`:. . `erase()` can be used on a single element of a vector, or a range of values (with the last value in the range being *exclusive*).. . You can use `.begin()` on a vector to get an iterator to the beginning of the vector. Adding an index to the iterator value to will get you to a location other than the beginning of a vector.. . If I wanted to erase a *single* element from a vector called `vec` (lets say, the third element): I would use `vec.erase(vec.begin() + 2)` since the third element is in index 2.. . Similarly, if I wanted to erase a range of elements, I could do: . ```cpp. vec.erase(vec.begin() + 2, vec.begin() + 6) \\ erase all elements from index 2-6, not including index 6. ```. . more info on this here: https://cplusplus.com/reference/vector/vector/erase/

content: . Hello, for one of the player tests, my partner and I are testing add and discard by having two hands; one hand has a card that is added and discarded and the other hand does not have any cards added and discarded, however we are making the hands / add and discard so that the played card should be the same for both. . . . I believe this test was noted as valid in Autograder (when I removed the test the score went from 16/17 to 14/17) however the issue is that we delete the first player after making their hand so later on when we do ASSERT_EQUAL for the played card in the first and second player, there is an out of bound error (it works locally but does not work in autograder). . How would we resolve this / make a change to avoid an out of bounds error (not sure how to do this). If we just delete the two players at the end of the test that is causing an issue. I have attached the test below for your reference.. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Player * bob = Player_factory("Bob", "Simple");. bob->add_card(Card(NINE, SPADES));. bob->add_card(Card(NINE, CLUBS));. bob->add_card(Card(QUEEN, SPADES));. bob->add_card(Card(ACE, SPADES));. bob->add_card(Card(KING, SPADES));. . . Card lead_card = bob->lead_card(SPADES);. . ASSERT_EQUAL(lead_card, Card(NINE,CLUBS));. . delete bob;. . Player * correct = Player_factory("Correct", "Simple");. correct->add_card(Card(JACK, SPADES));. correct->add_card(Card(NINE, CLUBS));. correct->add_card(Card(QUEEN, SPADES));. correct->add_card(Card(ACE, SPADES));. correct->add_card(Card(KING, SPADES));. . . correct->add_and_discard(. Card(NINE, HEARTS) // upcard. );. . Card lead_card2 = bob->lead_card(SPADES);. ASSERT_EQUAL(lead_card2, Card(NINE,HEARTS));. . // Verify the card Bob played. ASSERT_EQUAL(bob, correct);. . delete correct;.

One option is to make two vectors, have each player play all their cards and put their cards into one of the two vectors, sort the two vectors, then assert that the vectors are equal.

subject: Simple Player: Making Trump round 2
content: Hi! When making trump for Simple Player in round 2, what happens if there are 1 or more cards in both the trump suit and the other suit of the same color? For example, if the trump suit is Heart, and the player has 1 or more face/ace Heart card and 1 or more face/ace Diamond card. Would the order_up_suit go to the suit that has more cards?
i_answer: When making trump, there is no trump suit yet. The point of making trump is to decide the suit of trump. It seems like you don't fully understand the making trump process, so let me explain before answering your question:. . During round 1, after cards are dealed, the next card in the deck, the "upcard" is flipped up, and this is a "potential trump". You go around, starting with the person after the dealer, asking if anyone wants to make this suit the trump suit, and everyone says yes or no. If someone says yes, the suit of the upcard becomes the trump suit, and the dealer picks up the upcard and discards a card. If all four people say no, the upcard is flipped back over (or at least, in a physical game of euchre).. . During the second round, you go around, again starting with the person after the dealer, asking if anyone wants to choose the trump suit (they can choose any suit now, not just say yes/no to the suit of the upcard). If someone chooses, the suit that they choose becomes the trump suit. If no one chooses, the dealer is forced to choose.. . The "trump" suit does not really exist in round 2, so it doesn't need to be considered. Also, only considering the "Next Suit" (other suit of same color), is not a real strategy used in euchre, it is just done to make the simpleplayer easier to code. In a real game you would just consider if you have a strong enough hand under some trump to choose that trump. (There is a disadvantage to being the one to choose the trump suit, I can explain in followup discussions if you're curious).. . Now, onto your question:. . In your example, I assume that you meant that Heart was the suit of the upcard. You do not need to consider this suit at all. Just consider the next suit, diamonds, following the rule given in the spec. If the player has one or more face or ace diamond, then make the trump suit diamonds, and if not, then you pass.. . Hope that helped!

subject: Shuffle function
content: Hi, . . I've implemented this function but it does not pass the public tests of pack.cpp, and I cannot figure out why. Please have a look and let me know.. . Thanks.. . . void Pack::shuffle(){.     int c=0;.     int s=cards.size()/2;.     .     .     while(c!=7){.         std::array<Card, PACK_SIZE> copy;.         for(int i=0;i<cards.size();i++){.             copy[i]=cards[i];.         }.         for(int i=0;i<s;i++){.             cards[i+i+1]=copy[i];.         }.         for(int i=s;i<cards.size();i++){.             cards[(i-s)*2]=copy[i];.         }.         c++;.         .     }.     .     next=0;. }

subject: Card Less Duplicates
content: Is it safe to assume that there will be no duplicate cards in the deck? I'm implementing the card_less function and I'm wondering if it's okay to write that if one of the cards is the right bower, it is automatically more valuable than the other card? This is of course assuming that there cannot be two of the same cards, and thus two right bowers.
i_answer: It is safe to assume there are no duplicates, but this doesn't mean you can't call Card_less on the same card (comparing a card to itself). You should return false when the card is equal to itself.

subject: Overload Operator Question
content: I have a conceptual question. For the std::istream & operator>>(std::istream &is, Card &card) function, I read in another post that we're supposed to return the is object at the end of the function. What's the point of doing this? I thought the purpose of this specific function was to take in input and fill a card accordingly. Why isn't this function void then? Or is it not possible for it to be void?
i_answer: Returning a reference to the input/output stream allows us to chain multiple objects together.. Take the insertion operator as an example.. int a = 3;. int b = 4;. cout << "a is " << a << ", b is " << b << endl;. This is able to print a is 3, b is 4 because the insertion operator returns a reference to the output stream. Otherwise, it would fail after the first insertion since for the second insertion operator, you are passing in a void(the return of cout << "a is ") and an int(a), which does not match the parameter types of the function.. . In our case, we want to chain input/output, so we can read in a rank and a suit on one line, for example. That's why we overload the operators with return types.

subject: Could somebody rank the difficulties of the pack.cpp functions?
i_answer: Adding onto the instructor answer - yes, shuffle is definitely the most difficult.. . Ranking the rest, though all are not that different in terms of difficulty (hardest to easiest):. - the istream constructor. - the default constructor. - deal_one. - reset and empty

subject: Could somebody rank the difficulties of the card.cpp functions?
i_answer: Adding onto the instructor answer - yes, the Card_less functions are 100% the hardest, I would say that the one that only considers trump might even be a little harder, because in the one that considers the led card, you can just call the trump one in like half of the scenarios (when both are in the led suit, etc.).. . I would say the rest are pretty equal, but if I had to rank them (from hardest to easiest):. - string_to_rank and string_to_suit. - the >> operators. - The >,<,==, etc. operators. - Suit_next. - The class functions - get_rank(), etc.. are all pretty equally easy

subject: Card_Less with trump
content: I'm finding my card_less functions are starting to get very long since the only way I can think to approach it is by checking every possible combination of cards (I.e. trump and not trump, both non trump, both trump) and when both cards are trump I have to check for both bowers, and the if-elses are really piling up.  Is there meant to be a simpler way to write this function other than just brute force checking or will lengthy if else statements like this suffice?
i_answer: The way I approached it was quite similar; if A was a trump and B was not, A would never be less than B, and vice-versa.If both were trump, you really only need to worry about whether A or B (or both) are one of the bower cards, since if neither are a bower card the normal "<" operator will suffice.Same goes if neither of the cards are of the trump suit; you can just use "<".I ended up with 3 main if statements, and inside the one that checks if both are trump cards, I had 3 more nested conditionals. That should be all you need, although using more isn't an issue as long as the code works.

subject: Is diamond or heart the trump?
content: If the simple player has jack of heart, jack of diamond, ace of hearts and ace of diamonds and ten of spade.  The upcard is  ten of diamond, what is the trump suits?   If the upcard is ten of heart, what is the trump suits?  Should both be diamond trump?
i_answer: If the upcard is the 10 of diamonds, then diamonds will be the proposed trump suit. If trump is made in the first round, then diamonds will become trump. . . If the upcard is the 10 of hearts, then hearts will be the proposed trump suit. If trump is made in the first round, then hearts will be the trump suit. . . If trump is made in round 1, the trump suit is the suit of the upcard.

subject: Checking errors in euchre.cpp

i_answer: Any combination of Players and Humans is allowed, including what you said. The bullet you're referring to means that it's invalid to try to specify a player other than those 2. For example, the user can't type something like "BigBrainPlayer" and have the program run as intended.

subject: Human player
content: I noticed, a human player when deciding to play or lead a card, it is completely their choice. In the base class, there are parameters to these functions like trump and upcard, but these aren't taken into consideration so do we just remove these in our overriden class in Human. And would we have to remove parameters for Simple Player as well. Thank you.
i_answer: If you remove the parameters, then the functions signatures are no longer the same as what they're trying to override. Then there will be a pure virtual function that you aren't implementing in the derived class, which is invalid since we're trying to make an instance of the class.. . It's ok to not use the parameters. We have to keep them because we're overriding a function in the derived class.

subject: False positive test
content: I'm testing to make sure the right suit is assigned as the led suit if the left bower is the leading card, but the test is returning a false positive on the autograder. I'm not sure what mistake this test is making.. . //false positive. TEST(test_when_left_bower_leading_card) {.     .     Suit trump = CLUBS;.     Card left_bower_lead = Card(JACK, SPADES);.     Card queen_diamonds = Card(QUEEN, DIAMONDS);.     // led suit card, led suit should be spades.     Card queen_spades = Card(QUEEN, SPADES);.     .     ASSERT_TRUE(Card_less(queen_diamonds, queen_spades, left_bower_lead, trump));. }
i_answer: The left bower is always the trump suit, so it counts as a Club rather than a Spade. So the led suit is Clubs, which is the same as trump, meaning neither Queen of Diamonds nor Queen of Spades are impacted by trump or led card. The default ordering is applied, which means using the default suit ordering since the ranks are the same. This ordering is Spades

subject: Simple Player Make Trump Strategy
content: Say my hand consisted of (Ace, Clubs), (King Clubs), (Ace Spades), (King Spades), (King Hearts). . Say the upcard is (10 Clubs), it's the second round, and I'm not the dealer. . . Would I order up a clubs or a spades? I'm unsure of what the simple player would order up because both spades and clubs are the same color as the trump card, and all the spades/clubs cards in this case are face or ace cards.
i_answer: Simple player only considers the next suit in the second round, so you would consider ordering up spades. In this scenario, because you have at least one face/ace spades card, you would order up spades.. . When we say "same color suit", we mean the suit that is the same color but not the same suit. Note in the second round, it is illegal to order up the same suit that was considered in the first round.

subject: Card.cpp
content: Hello,. . for the function card_less(&a, &b, trump) I'm a little confused as to what trump means in this situation, would that be if it was diamond, then the trump card would be hearts, and if spades then clubs would be trump, and the opposite as well, and in this situation would the condition a<b be the first condition?. . Thank you.
i_answer: `trump` is the parameter that you'll be passing in when you call this function in your game implementation. For instance, if `trump` that is passed in is `SPADES`, then your `card_less` function would need to take that into account when comparing two cards as trump is considered the suit of the highest value.

subject: All possible trump/led suit combinations
content: A) Just to check, are these all the possible trump/led suit scenarios per trick?. 1. The led suit != the trump suit. 2. The led suit == trump suit. 3. There is a led suit but there was no trump suit. . B) Relatedly, is invoking [screw the dealer] forced at all times, or do we in this project have the option whether to invoke or not? Because if we are forced to always invoke [screw the dealer], then scenario (3.) is impossible, since trump will always be made by the end, right?. . C) And for screw the dealer situation, does the dealer have to order up the other same-color suit as the (rejected) upcard specifically, or can they choose any of the 3 non-rejected suits?. . D) Separate question: If a trump suit is declared in round 1 or 2 of making trump, does the dealer HAVE to swap the upcard with one of their cards or can they choose not to swap?
i_answer: A) Technically 1 and 2 comprise all cases since the led and trump suit can only either be equal or not equal, so I'm not 100% sure what the cases are that you're specifying.. . B) Screw the dealer is enforced, so if we're ever in round 2 of making trump and it's the dealer's turn, the dealer must order up, and trump will be chosen by that player.. . C) For the Simple Player strategy, the dealer will order up the "next suit" of the upcard, so the same-color suit as you said. In a real game of euchre, you could choose any suit that wasn't the suit of the upcard.. . D) The dealer only picks up the upcard if trump is made during round 1 (rather than round 2). The dealer will pick up the upcard always and then discard something, but the card they discard could be the upcard. (For the Simple Player strategy, this happens if the upcard is less than all the cards the dealer currently has in their hands)

subject: string_to_rank()
content: When I run Pack_public_test.exe, I get the error. . "Running test: test_pack_istream_ctor. Assertion failed: (false), function string_to_rank, file Card.cpp, line 35.". . I don't know why I keep getting this error since this function was provided in the starter files and I didn't edit it.
i_answer: string_to_rank() asserts false if the inputted string does not match any of the strings in the RANK_NAMES array in Card.cpp. In other words, if your inputted string isn't anything like "Two," "Three," ..., "King," or "Ace," you'll hit that assert. I recommend using your debugger to check the value passed into string_to_rank() when the assert fails. (A hackier way of debugging this is to just print each rank string read in from your input stream, and see which one definitely isn't a rank).

subject: Making_trump
content: When it is round 2 and it is the dealer's turn. If the up_card suit is Hearts and the dealer has a NINE HEARTS and a KING Diamonds. Does he play the highest one because they are both the same color as the up_card? Or does he play the first one in the order of his card setup which would be the NINE of HEARTS?
i_answer: Players don't play cards during making trump. If it's round 2 of making trump and it's the dealer's turn, the dealer has to order up (this is called *screwing the dealer* in the spec). To answer the other question, Nine of Hearts would be trump suit, but King of Diamonds would not be since it's a Diamond rather than a Heart.

subject: Human player

subject: Difference between > and >= operator in card.cpp
content: Is the difference between these two functions only that the second function will assume two same cards could exist within the playing deck? (because I'm assuming that there generally can't be two of the same in normal circumstances...?). 1. bool operator<(const Card &lhs, const Card &rhs). 2. bool operator<=(const Card &lhs, const Card &rhs)
i_answer: Try ignoring the nonexistence of duplicates in a deck of cards. Just imagine someone describes two cards to you and asks if they are the same or if the one on the left is less than or greater than the one on the right. So >= just returns true if either > is true or == is true.

subject: redefinition of Card class

i_answer: You don't want to have class Card {...}; in your cpp file because this is redefinition.. If you need to implement a function outside the class, what you can do is for example Rank Card::get_rank() const {...}. "Card::" specifies that this function is a member function of class Card.

subject: How to test void functions? Player_tests.cpp
content: I have currently found 16 bugs and need one more for player_tests.cpp. I was wondering whether some of these bugs were in functions like add_and_discard but it is void so I do not know how to assert a statement to test for that function. I have read @1586 for testing multiple branches but can't seem to find the remaining bugs.
i_answer: For functions like add_and_discard, you are not going to assert on the function's return value (since it is void), but on the effect that calling that function had on the simple player's hand. For example, if I were to test the add_add_discard function, I would initialize a simple player and populate the player's hand with five cards. Then I would call the player's add_and_discard function with some upcard. Finally, I would check that the correct card was removed from the player's hand.Follow up if you have any questions!

subject: == operator overload

subject: card_tests false positive
content: I'm getting a false positive for the test cases for the card_less function, and I know they are right but I'm not sure why the autograder is calling them false positives. These are for both of the card_less functions. . . . .
i_answer: The statement "Card a2 is less than card b2" should be true, but you're calling an ASSERT_FALSE() on that statement.. . b2 is the left bower since the trump is diamonds and b2 is the jack of hearts (the other red jack). The left bower is the second highest card in the game, second only to the right bower (in this case, jack of diamonds). However, your test is trying to assert that a2 would be higher than b2. a2 is not the right bower, so b2 is higher than a2.. . Conceptually, treat the left bower as trump. In this case, the jack of hearts should be considered a diamond by card_less.

subject: p3 simple player
content: Adding the Upcard and Discarding a CardIf the trump suit is ordered up during round one, the dealer picks up the upcard. The dealer then discards the lowest card in their hand, even if this is the upcard, for a final total of five cards. (Note that at this point, the trump suit is the suit of the upcard.)for the simple player, is that mean during this part, they only consider the value of the card and ignore the suit totally?
i_answer: No, the simple player will take the trump suit into account when deciding what card to discard. Your Card_less function should be used in SimplePlayer add_and_discard.

subject: operator<< and operator>> functions in Card.cpp
content: When implementing the functions that read and print a Card, should we use the helper functions already implemented for us in Card.cpp? I'm referring to functions like these:. . . //EFFECTS Prints Rank to stream, for example "Two". std::ostream & operator<<(std::ostream &os, Rank rank) {. os << RANK_NAMES[rank];. return os;. }. . //EFFECTS Reads a Rank from a stream, for example "Two" -> TWO. std::istream & operator>>(std::istream &is, Rank &rank) {. string str;. is >> str;. rank = string_to_rank(str);. return is;. }.
i_answer: Yes, those are just helpers for reading in or printing out Rank/Suit enum types. Those will be inherently called if you try to do something like cout << SPADES (Suit enum type).

subject: Making trump on round 2

i_answer: If we're on round 2 and we reach the dealer, then the dealer must order up the suit of the same color of upcard (ie. if upcard = Spades, order up Clubs), no matter what

subject: deal_one
content: How do I increment next after I return the next card since it will never reach the increment?
i_answer: You can use a temp variable to hold the current value of next so that you can increment next and still have a copy its old value. Or you can use a postfix increment on next. For example, return array[i++] will return array[i] and then increment i after returning.

subject: Player_factory "pure virtual function" error

I've seen people forget "const" or an "&", which would technically make it a different function and cause this issue

subject: card_less() - what to do when both cards are not led suit or trump?
content: I play euchre at home, so I am asking this question with (potentially flawed) background knowledge. The card_less() function is supposed to compare the value of two cards based on various scenarios. The only scenario that is unclear to me is when both cards belong to neither the led suit nor the trump suit. This situation is never relevant in a normal game of euchre, as the other cards in the trick should take precedence. However, this function only compares two cards, so I am confused how to approach this scenario.. . I recognize this explanation is somewhat confusing, so let me know if there is anything I can clarify.
i_answer: From the spec: value of cards.. When there is no trump nor lead suit, it fits the simplest case: cards are ordered by rank (A > K > Q > J > 10 > 9), with ties broken by suit (D > C > H > S).. For example, Ace of Hearts > King of Diamonds, Queen of Clubs > Queen of Spades.

subject: Find the lowest card in hands
content: In the Q&A part, I saw. "You shouldn’t need to sort using card less. When you print the hand in order it should be sorted using the < operator. You could sort with card less when determining what action to take, but you should be able to find the min/max card in the hand without sorting. You could use a functor to sort using card less, but those are only covered later in the course.". . I'm confused, how can I find the lowest card without using card_less? (I'm talking about add_and _discard() )
i_answer: You can find the lowest card with Card_less. The statement you quoted is trying to say that you shouldn't have to sort the entire hand to do so. Instead, you can just use the more standard way to find the min/max of an array.

subject: SimplePlayer play_card()
content: In the spec it says:. Playing Tricks. When playing a card, Simple Players use a simple strategy that considers only the suit that was led. A more complex strategy would also consider the cards on the table.. If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit. Otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand.I understand which card to return but how is the trump parameter used here? Is it used for both determining which card is higher / lower?
i_answer: For example: when you are looking for the lowest card when you don't have the led suit (assume trump is hearts and led is diamonds). Your lowest card not considering trump is 9 of hearts, but your lowest card considering trump is 10 of clubs. In this case you need to consider trump.

subject: help with card_les()
content: bool Card_less(const Card &a, const Card &b, Suit trump). . Hello,. . For this function, I set a boolean called cardLess as false and wrote all the conditions that could make it true. Like when b is right bower, when b is a trump card but a is not, and a and b are both not trump cards, then I used the < operator to check if a is less than b. then I return cardLess. Is there some situations I did not cover or is this a good implementation? Please let know.. . Thank you. . .
i_answer: You're definitely on the right track. It may be helpful to categorize the possible differences in a bit more organized fashion to see if you're covering all cases. Here's how I would start:. . Are they both trump? If so, is either a bower? I'll let you figure out the rest of this case. Is only one of them trump?. Is neither trump?. . Enumerating each case like this starting from larger-and-more-general to smaller-and-more-specific will let you make sure you're considering every possible case.

subject: Auto Grader card tests question
content: Hi, in autograder I submitted these two functions, which report false positives.  I thought that these operators do not consider trump? So why wouldnt these tests be correct?. . . Card TrumpJack(JACK, SPADES);. Card CopyJack(JACK, CLUBS);. TEST(x) {.     ASSERT_TRUE(TrumpJack == CopyJack);. }. TEST(y) {.     ASSERT_FALSE(TrumpJack != CopyJack);. }
i_answer: While the operators do not check for trump, they do check for the suit of the card. == will only return true if the two cards are exactly equal, meaning the rank and suit are the same, irrespective of anything else (like trump).

subject: Order of suits
content: So I understand the the strongest suit is the trump, and the next strongest is the suit of the same color (e.g. if the trump is diamonds, the next strongest suit is hearts). But what is the stronger suit between the remaining two suits (in the same example, is clubs or spades stronger)?
i_answer: The trump suit is the strongest suit in the deck. The rest of the suits (including the suit of the other color) follows by the pattern mentioned in the spec Diamonds > Clubs > Hearts > Spades.

subject: Is a left bower simultaneously in its own suit and the trump suit?
content: If the trump suit is hearts, then someone leads with jack of diamonds, then is the leading suit trump or diamonds?
i_answer: From the moment trump is made (and also while considering trump during make_trump but that's not important here), **the left bower is the trump suit**. So If trump is Hearts, Jack of Diamonds would be a Heart rather than a Diamond for the duration of the hand. This also means if someone leads with Jack of Diamonds, the lead suit is trump, which is Hearts.

subject: Trying to push changes to shared github
content: Hey I am trying to push changes to a shared github but I get this error in the process.
i_answer: Run the following command:. . git push --set-upstream origin main. . Or replace main with the name of whatever branch you are on. You don't do git push [filename] ever. Instead, you git add [filename], then commit your changes, and just run git push. The "--set-upstream origin main" is optional, and it just tells git where to push to by default.

subject: call member functions
content: what can I do if I call is_trump() later, is it a.is_trump(), for a be the card I want to check (const Card &a).  Thanks for your help!
i_answer: Yes! When dealing with class objects, you would use the dot (.) operator to call any member functions of that class on the object. For example, if you were to do what you suggested by calling a.is_trump(trump); (don't forget to pass in a trump value as well) it would return whether or not that object is the same suit as the trump suit. . . Think of it this way, each card is an entirely separate "copy" of the card class, therefore using the dot operator calls the member functions just for that card. Even if the function doesn't take in a card variable the private member variables are declared specifically to that card (i.e. rank and suit) which makes this possible. Hope this makes sense!

subject: Suit_next()
content: Since we need to have a return value in all control paths, should we just return the suit given in the end if nothing hits the if statements(even though it should)? Thank you.
i_answer: Try adding an else statement somewhere. For instance if I know that the value passed in a function is either 1 2 or 3, I can write the function like this:. . ```. if input == 1 return "1". else if input == 2 return "2". else if input == 3 return "3". ```. In this case we don't return in all control paths, because what if the user inputs 4? However, because we know that the user can't input 4, we can write it like this to ensure that we return in all control paths:. ```. if input == 1 return "1". else if input == 2 return "2". else return "3". ```. This is just pseudocode but hopefully you'll be able to understand the analogy I'm trying to make and apply it to cards.

i_answer: It should be failing, since you haven't defined the functions in Card.h, which is why it is failing. You need to define function stubs as stated in the spec, and then it will compile (though it will still fail because you will have assert(false) in each of them.

subject: Question for comparison of a C string and a C++ string
content: . In the card.cpp the fif statement is comparing a c++ string (str) and a c string (RANK_NAMES[r] since. . const char *const RANK_NAMES[] RANK_NAMES is just a list of pointers to const char that has been initialized as string literals).. . I dont understand why we can compare a C++ string and a C string especially because the c string is declared as a pointer to const char. . My conjecture is that since the c string is a pointer pointing to the first character of the string literal is initialized to and since c string is a pointer to char. and str is also pointing to the first character of the c++ string, when we are comparing the c string witha  c++string via there variable name we are comparing. the address of their first character not the string it self because the variable name both can represent pointer but pointer to two different type of string.. However, when I am trying to check my conjectrue in an online c++ compiler. It proves me to be wrong. The == go trhough every char of both type of string and check if their value is equal. I am not sure why my conjecture is wrong could someone please help?.
i_answer: Think about how operators are defined. The way we have been doing it is just defining it for two objects of the same type. However, you can also define operators between two different object types:. . . bool operator==(const ClassA& a, const ClassB& b) {.     // some implementation. }  . . In cpp, the == operator is defined between cstring's and std::string's, and it just compares them by comparing their contents.

subject: Class Question for Simple Player
content: Hi, the instructions say:. . Implement the Simple Player in Player.cpp by creating a class that derives from our Player abstract base class. Override each Player function in Player.cpp for the functions declared in Player.h.. . Does this mean to create a new class SimplePlayer? And put the func definition in the header file?
i_answer: No, it means that you should be creating a derived class. More info on that can be found in the notes here.

subject: question about euchre rules round 1
content: if the dealer replaces the upcard with one of their own cards, does their card that they replaced it with become the new trump suit? or does it say the same? for example, say the upcard was hearts, and the dealer swapped out their own diamonds card for the upcard. would the trump suit still be hearts?
i_answer: The trump suit is the suit of the upcard. In your example, the trump suit would be hearts.

subject: friend declaration in card.cpp
content: Hi.. For the private member function in card.cpp: . friend std::istream & operator>>(std::istream &is, Card &card);. Do we have to implement this function or we can use this in our other card.cpp functions?
i_answer: This function is in place so that the normal function can access the private member variables of the Card class. You do not have to implement this friend function, it essentially serves as a reference to the normally declared std::istream & operator>>(std::istream &is, Card &card); function that can be found below without the friend prefix. You'll use this function to directly access the rank and suit member variables. Hope that helps

subject: player.cpp error removing card
content: I am having an issue with removing a card from a vector in the Player.cpp functions. I looked online for the error I am getting, but there was no help. See the bottom of the screenshot for the error.. Screenshot_2023-02-05_at_7.26.57_PM.png
i_answer: The erase function takes in an iterator to the object being erased. In order to get an iterator, you can call the vector.begin() function which gives you an iterator to the first element. Just like you do with address mathematics, you can then add the position to get the iterator to a specific element in a vector. An example looks like vec.erase(vec.begin() + x). See here for more details.
